loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh is a 33 years old and has four children. He lives with his family in the southern Lebanese town of Saida. Saleh makes a living selling scrap, and also owns a grocery store. He has applied for his third loan from Al Majmoua. He plans to use this latest loan to close down his current grocery store and open up a new one.

loans.use: to open up a new grocery store

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.en:
Oswaldo feels very satisfied with the achievements he has obtained up until now. Thanks to his work on his little farm and the collaboration of his friendly oxen that help him in the process. Not long ago he acquired land and wishes to build a home on it so that he can offer a higher level of comfort to his family. His objective in the sort run is to increase his income by optimizing the quality of his products.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Oswaldo, se siente muy satisfecho por los logros obtenidos hasta el día de hoy gracias a su trabajo en la chacra y a sus más grandes colaboradores que son sus amigables bueyes que le ayudan en el proceso de siembra. Hace poco ha adquirido un terreno y desea construir en el su hogar para brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia. Su objetivo a corto plazo para alcanzar este fin es incrementar la siembra de gladiolos en sus terrenos de cultivo y optimizar la calidad de los mismos.

loans.use: Increase of capital in order to optimize yield

loans.name: Ana María

texts.en:
Ana Maria, a member of the Village Bank Arco Iris, is 37 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She lives in the district of San Juan Bautista, a province of Huamanga. Ana Maria has a store in her home where she sells groceries, meat, and vegetables; she also has a smaller store where she sells vegetables, chicken and condiments. She is able to maintain both businesses with the help of her daughter. 

Ana Maria now needs a loan of $350, money which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, and oil. 

Her dreams are to develop her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank (meaning Gold Heart in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Carmen is a married 25-year-old mother of one daughter. Carmen and her husband raise and sell guinea pigs on her sister´s land in the city of Huanta, a business they have had for one year. Furthermore, Carmen works in her sister´s flower shop where she arranges flowers.

Carmen needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($375 USD) to invest in more guinea pigs.

Carmen’s dream is to have her own flower shop, have more space for her guinea pigs, and that her daughter becomes a professional.

loans.use: Carmen needs a loan to invest in more guinea pigs.

loans.name: Abdurasul.

texts.ru:
Abdurasul B. lives in the city of Yavan, in one of its outlying areas. The life in his community is very difficult. He is 58 and he has lived his whole life there. He is married and has six children. Abdurasul is a teacher in a lyceum № 1 in Yavan. Additionally, almost everyone in his community has farm animals at home. Abdurasul has one bull. He decided to ask for a loan and purchase one more young, well-bred bull. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоалиев Абдурасул проживает в городе Яван , в одном из дальних кишлаков. Жизнь в его кишлаке очень тяжелая. Ему 58 лет и всю жизнь он прожил там. Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Работает учителем в лицее № 1 города Яван. Кроме того почти у каждого жителя кишлака есть домашнее хозяйство. Вот и у него имеется один бычок. Он решил получить кредит и купить еще одного молодого , породистого бычка , а погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a bull

loans.name: Mrs. Toek Hoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank which consists of sixteen people is located in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and Mrs. Toek H. is the village bank president. She owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Sam Nhich, raises one cow and twenty chickens in his house which can assist his wife to support the household. Mrs. Toek H. is 42 years old and the mother of a child, 13, who is enrolled in the local school. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainL. end-of-term loans. Twelve members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando es un noble trabajador que se dedica a la crianza de animales, sobre todo al ganado vacuno, los compra y vende en los mercados de las ciudades más comerciales.Esta actividad es muy agradable, porque el criar animales es lo que le agrada desde muy  pequeño, sin embargo, también tiene que ocuparse en otras actividades, y una de ellas es la de agricultor, cultiva papa y maíz en sus respectivas temporadas para cuidar que el mal tiempo pueda dañar sus productos.  Por esta razón, requiere de una cierta cantidad de dinero para trabajar sus terrenos de cultivo, el monto que necesita le ayudará a aumentar su producción y con ello, incrementar los ingresos económicos en su hogar, además de tener solvencia para seguir trabajando en sus chacras y en la compra y venta de animales.
texts.en:
Fernando is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells in the most commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, because raising animals is what he has enjoyed most since he was a young boy. Nevertheless he also has other jobs, and one of those is of farmer as he grows potato and corn in their respective seasons taking in to account the bad weather that could damage his products. For this reason, he requires a certain amount of money to work his land, his goal is to increase his product and thereby increase his household income in addition to being solvent in order to continue working on his farm and buying and selling animals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his capital to invest in preparing his land for growing crops

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of six people from the village of Slab Ta Aon Village in Kandal province, and they are seeking a loan for different business purposes. Mrs. Chantha S. was selected by the other group members to be the group leader.

By way of a brief background, Mrs. Chantha S. is a 37-year-old widow, and she has one child who attends the local school. She sells goods in the local village for a living. And, because her business has been doing well, she wants to expand the business. As such, she is seeking a loan to buy more goods to re-sell, which she hopes will improve her family's living conditions in turn.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing inventory

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco es padre de familia y junto con su esposa la señora Yuriria buscan darles a sus hijos un mejor estilo de vida; ellos están solicitando este crédito para colocar una losa de concreto del cuarto que construyeron para darle ampliación a su casita.
texts.en:
Francisco is a family man and together with his wife, Yuriria, he seeks to provide his children with a better way of life. They are requesting a loan to install a concrete floor in a room, built as an addition to their small home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a concrete floor in a room.

loans.name: Blanca Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a member of the Muchuy Warakaq Village Bank. She is 38 years old and married with three children. Edith and her husband own a business selling construction materials like sand and renting out heavy machinery. The couple has been running this business since 1997, and currently has five employees.

Edith is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy fuel for the machinery. She says 1200 soles worth of fuel will last for one to two days, and she plans to take out loans with other financial institutions to pay for the rest of the fuel she needs.

Edith’s goal for the future is to continue to expand her business and to buy more heavy machinery.

loans.use: To pay for the fuel for heavy machinery.

loans.name: Vincent's Group

texts.en: Vincent S. is a member of the 10-member Byona Biyinzika group in Kyebando, Uganda. He is a businessman and since 1993 he has been a distributor of sodas and beer that he sells in cases to retailers who sell to their customers for 600 – 700 shillings. The beers and sodas are distributed to Vincent's shop directly and he does not have to spend on transport costs. He has been with his lending group for the past nine years and he has not regretted it. Vincent has a dream of using he savings to build commercial houses for rent. With his loan, he plans on stocking more beers and sodas.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael O. is 35 years old and married with four children. She has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods like rice, beans, and yams. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Djamil

texts.en: Djamil is 23 years old. He is single and lives in Ashagi-Zeyid village, in the Khachmaz region. He has been in the sheep breeding business for 4 years. Djamil is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 25 additional sheep to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy 25 sheep

loans.name: Mwajabu's Group

texts.en: B. Mwajabu is happy that she has been able to repay back her loan on time and, above all, that she has been able to expand her shop and pay school fees for her seven dependants who are still in school. She is the leader of Twisakirala women’s group in Jinja where she manages her retail shop; it has been operational for 5 years. Mwajabu needs a loan to be able to buy more products for her shop. She has a dream of constructing rental houses on the plot of land that she bought and this loan will increase her income and profits.

loans.use: Buy more products for her shop.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. lives and works in Nyamasaria slum in Kisumu, Kenya. She has 3 children and is married to a husband who is currently unemployed. She is a school teacher and would like to use this loan to buy more books for the children in her school and expand her business. She heard about K-MET because the school she teaches in is located next to the church where K-MET teaches community-based health workers. We had a chance to see her at work at the school and her children love her. When it comes time to journal, we will upload pictures of some of the children and a picture of the school. Mercy says that she would like lenders to know that if you believe in something that is good, you can make it happen.

Mercy recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: getting more books and other improvements to her school

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia T. is 65 years old and married to a farmer. She resides at Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She became a member of the Paglaum Cooperative in 2001.

Now, she has asked for a loan amounting to 20,000 Philippine Pesos intended for additional capital for her variety store. She will purchase grocery items such as: assorted canned goods, laundry and bath soap, shampoos, noodles, seasonings, beverages, and many others. Her husband is a miner. The couple started their business with their own capital from what they were able to save from her husband's meager income from farming.

She hopes she can save enough for her old age and have a healthy life ahead.

loans.use: Inventory for sari-sari store

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with one young daughter. He uses his car to offer taxi services in his city and between neighboring cities as well. Sergei has been in this business for 11 years. Using the phone to get client’s orders he always has plenty of clients. This business is the only source of income for his family.

Sergei would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to fix his car engine. As he makes more profit, he hopes to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To fix the engine in his taxi

loans.name: Santiago Parada Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo "Santiago Parada" esta representado Silvia y conformada por 12 miembros dentro los cuales presenta un parentesco familiar entre la señora Sonia y la señora Luz Marina que son hermanas, pero ambas tienen ingresos independientes. En general los socios se dedican a la venta de productos como cosméticos, zapatos, CDs, ropa y comida. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia de la oferta y la demanda de productos pero las socias saben como enfrentarlo, con trabajo y esfuerzo. El crédito esta destinado a la diversificación de los productos así como para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar mayores ingresos para el sustento de sus familias. A pesar que es un grupo relativamente nuevo los socios cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a su participación en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital quien les da un apoyo económico para sus proyectos de crecimiento.
texts.en:
The members of the Santiago Parada Loan Group are represented by Silvia. The group consists of twelve members, among whom there is a family relationship between Señora Sonia and Señora Luz Marina who are sisters but who have independent incomes. In general, the members are engaged in the sale of products such as cosmetics, shoes, CD's, clothing and prepared food. As in any business situation, there is the competition of supply and demand for products but the group members know that they must respond to this with work and effort. The loan is intended for product diversification such as for the acquisition of materials, ingredients and tools that will help to generate greater incomes for the sustenance of their families. Despite the fact that this is a relatively new group, they have experience in solidarity groups thanks to their particpation in entities similar to the Fundación Agrocapital which is giving them economic support for their growing projects.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Niru

texts.en:
Mrs. Niru K. lives in a single family with her husband and three sons in Sainbu-Bhaishipati Lalitpur. Her husband, Mr. Bhai Krishna K., is a driver. All her sons are now studying in grades 11, 10 and 9 respectively.

Mrs. Niru is a grocery shopkeeper. She opened her grocery store to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different varieties of grocery foods in her shop such as maize, rice, noodles, biscuits etc.

Mrs. Niru is applying for a loan of Rs 30,000  to purchase additional grocery items for her store to attract new customers.

loans.use: To buys grocery goods

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
“The thing I’ve learned is that you can’t wait for things to come to you,” says Katrina about her mobile massage company. Since losing her job at a spa when it closed down, she has focused on her own business working mostly with motorcyclists, racers, and mechanics recovering from injuries and surgery. Since her clients rarely seek out a massage therapist, Katrina has built partnerships with automotive businesses who bring her in to work on their employees. This niche market has enabled Katrina to establish a loyal customer base, but she needs to expand her client list in order to build a sustainable business.

A $3,000 loan will help Katrina buy a car to that she can travel to more businesses, and even raceways and other events, in order to expand beyond her current client base.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Katrina from  United States

loans.use: Purchase a car in order to travel to more businesses/clients

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalla L. is engaged in hog-raising. She is also selling vegetables in her humble vending stall located just in front of their house in the village of Catabban Burgos, Isabela. She is already 42 years old and is married to Bernardo L., now 52 years old. The couple is blessed with four children of whom their youngest is the one left attending school in college, taking up an education course.

Amalla shared with us that her family's major source of income is farming. She manages her hog-raising to be able to help her husband in their farming and cover family necessities. She wants to further develop her business to progress in order to give sufficient support to her family, especially for the education of her youngest child. Seeking the support of Kiva loans is the option she learned about. She hopes to borrow PHP 12,000 as additional business capital to improve her hog-raising business and to purchase at least 2 or 3 sacks of feed to supply the daily food of the livestock till they are ready for disposal.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Manfredo Cuellar Group

texts.es: El grupo “Manfredo C.” esta representado por la señora Betty y conformado 13 miembros  los cuales han demostrado responsabilidad y honestidad en sus reuniones. Una gran mayoría de las socias se dedican a la venta de productos como Comida, abarrotes, cosméticos por catalogo, ropa y a actividades como el transporte público de pasajeros, construcción de viviendas y empleadas domesticas. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El destino del crédito es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The ‘Manfredo C.’ group is represented by Sra. Betty. It is comprised of thirteen members who have demonstrated responsibility and honesty in their meetings. A large majority of the members earn their living selling such products as food, groceries, cosmetics by catalogue, clothing, or by activities such as public transportation of passengers, house construction, and domestic service. There is a lot of competition, but the members have a great deal of experience and know how to make their businesses successful: by offering a variety of good-quality products. They plan to use the loan as working capital and start small businesses in order to generate more income. In this way they will gradually improve the quality of life of their families. For this reason they are very grateful for the confidence shown in them and will carry on working with more enthusiasm. The members are taking out their first loan, but they already talk knowledgeably about group solidarity. They promise to work together responsibly and make every effort to help each other succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos 2 Group

texts.en:
Bladimir is the group coordinator of "Unidos Venceremos" (Together We Are Victorious) which is based in a community surrounding La Romana where electricity and running water (none of which is potable) is unreliable at best. Here he makes his home with his wife and two adolescent children in a rented home with concrete walls and a tin roof.

Bladimir plans to use this loan to invest in his business selling fruit juice and small pastries, which is the family's primary source of income. He will purchase a sack of flour, two and a half sacks of sugar and five dozen varieties of fruits.

Bladimir came to Esperanza with the goal of improving his business through access to credit, and is now on his third loan after having successfully repaid the first two. With the added benefits coming from increased productive capacity, Bladimir hopes to be able to move out of his rented home and purchase his own home. In the long term, he dreams of one day purchasing a truck to help expand his mobile fruit juice business. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, cups and fruit

loans.name: Agob

texts.en:
Agob is a 64 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Agob has owned a coffee shop since 1984. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new coffee machine and pay his children's school tuition. Agob has been a microcredit client for eleven years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him diversify his merchandise and improve his coffee shop. Agob's work is special because his coffee shop is cozy. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Agob first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase a new coffee machine and pay his children's school tuition.

loans.name: Leody

texts.en:
Leody is a diligent farmer. He is 41 years old, married, and has one child. His hectare (2.5 acres) of rice field needs farm inputs. He joined CEVI last September 2009 to obtain its financial services.

Leody thinks CEVI’s program is very helpful to him and his fellow farmers. He requested Php 6,000 to finance his farm.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn P.'s main source of income comes from selling scrap metal and other used products in her community. She is 20 years old, married and has a small child. They are from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. Madelyn has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Madelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Madelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 pesos from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase products to sell. Madelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 pesos which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son S., 27, lives in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia, where she earns a living by selling firewood and charcoal. Son S. is a good mother of two kids: one is a student and the other one does not go to school.

She is married to Sopheap, age 34, who is a taxi driver. He was hired by a neighbor to drive a taxi. In view of the fact that firewood and charcoal selling is Son S.’s main source of income to sustain her family’s living conditions, and in order to better meet the needs of her customers, Son S. is applying for a loan as capital to accumulate a larger amount of her product for sale.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger amount of her product for sale

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine M. lives in Yerevan with her retired parents, brother and sister. Armine was a presenter on radio and TV, where she organized programs about a children's home named “Zatik” (“Ladybird”) in order to attract sponsors for it. After that, she, together with her brother, founded “Hope and Law” Christian Public Organization of Right Defence. Under this organization Armine has a publishing house, “Children’s world”, and all her employees are young people who have left the children’s home once they had grown up. They publish “My and your planet”, which is a colored children’s monthly newspaper, with a circulation of 4,000 copies in 3 languages: Armenian, English and Russian.

In May, 2009, after a street accident, Armine broke her leg. She can't walk, so she uses a wheelchair to do her duties, in order to realize a big number of programs for the children’s home and for children's education at Armenian University and Institutes when they have grown up.
 
Armine needs 600.000 AMD to publish books for children, which are translated by herself into Armenian and Russian from English. In the future, Armine hopes to engage a lot of people and organizations in her programs and establish connections with children's homes in other countries.

loans.use: To publish books for children.

loans.name: Jacline Achieng

texts.en: Jacline M., age 33, owns NON, her fish-selling business.  She has one employee and has been selling fish for three years.  The kind of fish she sells is small and called Omena.  It is used to eat and for processing into food meal.  She sells to individuals and to light food processors.  In this business, she manages competition and high transport costs as well as fluctuations in fish supplies.  She is using the loan to purchase more stock to sell to processors.  Her business goal is to grow and be a supplier for the major processing plants.  She is married to a driver and has one son, 5 years old.  Jacline describes herself as determined, forward-looking, god-fearing and hard-working.

loans.use: to buy more stock to supply processors

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: D. Delphine est née en 1964 au Bénin. Delphine vit depuis une dizaine d’année à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à LAROU Nicolas un entrepreneur, Delphine est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de leurs enfants. La famille vit ensemble à Cadjèhoun. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Delphine n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Delphine vend de l’igname pilé accompagné de sauce d’arachide (un aliment bien aimé des béninois) en face du Ministère des Finances au Bénin. Delphine exerce cette activité depuis environs  10 ans. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Delphine s’approvisionne. Delphine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Delphine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’agrandir davantage son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
D. Delphine was born in 1964 in Benin.  She has been living for about ten years in Cadjèhoun, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to LAROU Nicolas, an entrepreneur, she is the mother of four children who are all in school.  The couple has another child to support in addition to their own.  The family lives together in Cadjèhoun. The couple is covering family expenses jointly.  Delphine did not attend school.  To provide for her needs and those of her children, she sells pounded yams served with peanut sauce (a much-loved food of the Beninese people) across from the Finance Ministry in Benin.  She has been in this business for about ten years.  She stocks up from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She is a previous ALIDé client having already had two loans from this micro-finance institution.  And the loans have indeed been repaid. Delphine is requesting a third loan from ALIDé in order to expand her business further and to satisfy her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of yams and sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, etc.)

loans.name: Rosario Margarita

texts.es:
Rosario Cedeño de 44 años, vive en una casa de cemento con agua y luz como servicios básicos su casa esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo trabaja en el taller de ebanistería tienen 3 hijos ya casados y trabajando.

Rosario comenzó a reunir dinero vendiendo colas, agua y helados para poder aportar a los ahorros para sacar el taller de muebles que querían con su esposo, ahora Rosario y su esposo tienen el taller en su casa, ella sigue vendiendo colas, agua y helados. Trabajan todos los días en el taller y vendiendo las bebidas, una de las mayores dificultades es la lluvia.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar madera, clavos, materiales para su negocio, en el futuro quiere poner otra sucursal de ebanistería.
texts.en:
Rosario Cedeño is 44 years old and lives in a cement house with simple plumbing and electricity. Her house is located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her husband works in a wood-working shop. They have three children who are all married and working.

Rosario began saving money selling soft drinks, water, and ice cream in order to contribute to their savings for the furniture workshop that she and her husband wanted. Now, Rosario and her husband have the workshop in their home. She is still selling soft drinks, water, and ice cream. They work every day in the workshop and selling beverages. One of their greatest struggles is the rain.

With the loan, she wants to buy wood, nails, and materials for the business. In the future, she wants to start another branch of the wood-working shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wood, nails, supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more shoes for sale

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza H. is currently in the business of selling beer and local alcohol at her bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell. Tereza is 29 years old and is married to a businessman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel (restaurant). About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie L. is a softhearted woman who is willing to extend help to the neediest member of ASHI in their center. Though the profit her business is making since she started is still small, Elsie feels happy when she has extended help to other people even in little ways and has augmented her husband’s small income. At least she has a source of money to support the basic needs of her children. With that, Elsie really wishes to make her business grow through the loan she is requesting now. She hopes to increase the inventory of goods she sells in her “sari-sari” (variety) store for the convenience of her customers and for her own satisfaction.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell in her "sari-sari" store.

loans.name: Ludie Salud

texts.en:
Ludie Salud R. is from the village of Annex near Ozamis City in the Philippines. She is 58 years old and married with 2 adult children. To make a living, Ludie Salud raises pigs for sale and she has been doing so for over 45 years, earning approximately 20000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ludie Salud joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ludie Salud is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ludie Salud from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin S. is 56 years old. She is a villager in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she is a clothing seller who can earn a small income to support her family. She does not have enough money to support her clothing business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for transport and the rest of the loan she would use to purchase more clothes to sell. Mrs. Chin S. is a widow with three children. One of her children is a laborer in Thailand, one is a laborer on a rubber farm, and one is a clothes seller who supports mother's business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transport and to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “SARITA COLONIA”, está conformado por 8 miembros emprendedores quienes viven en la zona de Chosica, departamento de Lima, trabajan con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad desde hace 1 año y 2 meses.
Rigoberto quien es socio del grupo, tiene 51 años, es casado, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad y uno Rigoberto asume el cargo de presidente desde hace 5 meses. Desde hace 3 años se dedica al alquiler de cabinas de internet, se inicio primero con video juegos y además su esposa administra una cafetería en un colegio. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado mejorar y construir su vivienda, ha ido creciendo como microempresario ya que ha comprado mas maquinas (computadoras). El gran sueño de Rigoberto es seguir creciendo y más adelante poner un locutorio (alquiler de líneas telefónicas).
El préstamo otorgado será utilizado para invertir en su negocio comprando máquinas (computadoras). Agradecen el apoyo brindado e iniciativa para su constitución como Alcancía Comunal y prometen cumplir con los pagos establecidos en las fechas pactadas.
texts.en:
The “Sarita Colonia” Communal Bank consists of eight enterprising members who live in the Chosica area of the Department of Lima. They have been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for a year and two months.

Rigoberto is a member of the group. He is 51 years old, married, and has three children. Two of them are adults and one still lives with him. Rigoberto was elected the group president five months ago. Three years ago, he decided to provide Internet booths for rent. He originally started a video game center and his wife manages a high school cafeteria. Through his hard work, Rigoberto was able to build and improve his home. He has already grown as a micro-entrepreneur by acquiring more computers. Rigoberto’s greatest wish is to continue growing and eventually open a call center (where he offers phones lines for rent). His loan will be invested in his business by purchasing additional computers. He appreciates the support and initiative of his Communal Bank and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computers

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty tiene 53 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos, de los cuales sólo vive con Jarol, de 11 años, en su casa propia, ubicada en una zona de selva.

Su actividad es la venta de productos comestibles en un espacio de su vivienda desde hace 10 años. Lamentablemente no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie, pero eso no la amilana, sino al contrario, le da fuerzas para salir adelante, pues está segura que sus hijos aprovechan su tiempo en actividades favorables para sí mismos.
Lo que más le gusta de su labor es atender a sus clientes de una manera cordial que asegure su regreso, por eso este negocio le resulta rentable porque gracias a su buena atención sus ventas son dinámicas.
Para más adelante, piensa ampliar su negocio surtiéndolo de mayor cantidad de mercadería solicitada por sus vecinos, quienes siempre incentivan su trabajo con palabras alentadoras.

Este es el séptimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y señala que desde que empezó a acceder a los empréstitos siente su progreso; por eso le gusta trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal que son personas muy confiables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará productos comestibles y de primera necesidad para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Betty is 53 years old. She is the single mother of 5 children, of whom only Jarol, who is 11 years old, lives with her. She lives in her own house, located in a forested region.

For 10 years, her business has been the sale of food products in a space in her house. Unfortunately, she has no one to help her, but this does not intimidate her. On the contrary, it gives her the strength to advance herself, since she is sure that her children make good use of their time in activities that are beneficial to them.

What she likes most about her work is attending to her customers in a cordial manner that assures their return. For this reason, her business is profitable for her, because thanks to her good service, her sales are dynamic.

In the future, she is thinking of expanding her business, stocking it with greater quantities of the merchandise requested by her neighbors, who always motivate her work with encouraging words.

This is her seventh loan with MFP, which indicates that it has noted her progress since it began to grant her loans. For this reason, she likes to work with the members of her community bank, who are very reliable people. With the money that she is seeking, she will buy food products and other basic products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina, a resident of Lahore, famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods, is the wife of M. J.. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for the last 25 years.
  
Her husband operates a movie-making business. He offers his services at functions such as weddings and birthday parties. He gets work by phone call and earns income. He has been in this profession for over 10 years. He has two workers in his shop and he pays them on a monthly basis. 

Zarina is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase a digital camera and improve the quality of his work.

loans.use: To purchase a digital camera for movie making business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorn S., 25 (pictured with her young daughter), and her husband, Mr. Broshun Nhoem, 30, have been married since 1998 and have two young daughters. The family lives along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Lorn has been selling fish for ten years, making her purchases from fisherman in the village and then selling them at Prek Phnao market. Her husband assists her in the business. She is asking for her first loan of $250 to add to her own money to purchase a motorbike to transport the fish to market.

loans.use: To add to her own money to purchase a motorbike to transport fish to sell.

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es: Zulema, de 25 años, es una madre muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Héctor de 26 años y su única hija Sharmely de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Desde muy pequeña Zulema aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo sobre esta actividad, hoy sola posee tierras en donde cultiva y produce alverja, papa y zanahoria, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, ya que recibe la recompensa de tanto meses de arduo trabajo. Es así que tiene 4 años trabajando en el campo y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que afectan su desarrollo. Con el tiempo espera, comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuota de humor en el grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Zulema, age 25, is a very unassuming and hard-working mother. She lives in a rented house with her 26 year old husband, Héctor, and their only child, three year old Sharmely. They are the motivation for all of her efforts. Since she was very small Zulema learned to work on the farm with her parents. They taught her everything about this activity. Now, she only has land where she plants and produces peas, potatoes, and carrots. She takes them the wholesale market in Tarma to sell. What she likes the most about her work is harvesting because she receives the recompense for so many months of hard work. She has been working like this in the fields for four years. She considers the most difficult part to be taking care of her crops so that the pests do not affect their development. In time she plans to buy more land to increase her production. This is her second loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments punctually, and she is prepared to do so. In her communal bank she is a very happy member who is always adding humor to the group. She will use the requested 500 soles to buy more fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to take care of her crops

loans.name: Leonor Indiana

texts.es:
Leonor Indiana es una mujer activa de 64 años de edad, desde hace años logro poner su propio negocio un pequeño comedor que ha logrado hacer crecer con los años.
Procreo dos hijos los cuales la apoyan con el negocio, entre las dificultades es que son días variados, unos días se venden mas y otros poco, pero es un negocio que no se deja de vender.
Con este financiamiento lograra aumentar la inversión de alimentos para su comedor, en donde comprara: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, harina, frutas y verduras, carnes, pollo en cantidades para la preparación diaria del menú.
A través de estos años, ha logrado la clientela, lo que se siente sastifecha de poder conservar su negocio.  Que es su fuente de ingreso para subsistir.
texts.en:
Leonor Indiana is an active, 64-year-old woman. Years ago she managed to start her own business, a small dining room, that she has managed to grow over the years. She has two children which she supports with the business. Among the difficulties she faces are that some days she sells more and other days she sells little. But it is a business where she can not stop selling. With this credit she will manage to buy more food for her dining room, such as rice, beans, sugar, flour, fruits and vegetables, meats, and chicken in quantities for the daily preparation of the menu. Through the years, she has attracted a growing clientele. She feels satisfied to be able to preserve her business, which is her source of income to subsist.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for the preparation of dishes for her restaurant

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en: Hà Nguyễn Thị (20201020048) is a 28 year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Hà is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nghiêm Xá Nhóm 14 (Nhóm 14). Hà is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Hà owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Hà has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,800,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2007, Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by her from SEDA. Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Nghiêm Thị L. (0) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Hà Nguyễn Thị (20201020048) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các tH.nh viên. Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nghiêm Xá nhóm 14 (Nhóm 14). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 3.800.000 VND. Vào 2007, Hà đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nghiêm Thị L. (0) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in a city called Multan, Pakistan, famous for its shrines and sweetmeats. She owns a small house of two rooms where she lives with her seven children and her husband of over 20 years.

Zarina has five sons and two daughters: her elder son has a timber-selling business; next to him is a painter who paints walls and windows on call; the next two work in a factory on monthly wages; the youngest of her sons is free and doesn’t do anything; her daughters stay at home and help their mother in managing the household chores.

Zarina’s husband is named N. M. and he has a job in the government sector as a security guard but earns a low income.

Zarina herself owns and operates her sewing business. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband and to make him relax from this aspect. Her care for him makes her unique and he respects her a lot.

Zarina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her elder son. With the loan, he will buy timber in bulk and increase his sales by selling to more customers. Zarina is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan.

loans.use: To purchase more timbers for her son's timber-selling business

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita B. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Tita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Tita owns & operates a business venture providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from hauling scrap metal for local businesses and community members. Tita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Tita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Tita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Prum Ngim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-two people make up this village bank loan located in Putthi Sam village in Takeo province. Mrs. Prum N., 40 years old, is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Soy Kem, is a rickshaw driver. 

She has a problem because her home is uncomfortable to live in. So, to improve this condition, Mrs. Prum N. is asking for a loan to fix up her own house. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a laborer, and the other is attending school. (The man in the back wearing a baseball cap is not a village bank member.)

loans.use: To fix up her own house

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle C., age 33, is from the village of Capayangan, Banisilan, Cotabato. Anabelle and her husband have one school-aged child. To make a living, Anabelle owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food and daily-use products in the local community. Anabelle has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

Anabelle joined HSPFI his year to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Anabelle is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anabelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cecilia Ama

texts.en: Cecilia Ama E. sells foodstuffs such as fresh tomatoes, onions, and other items at Elmina.  She has attained junior high level of education.  She is married to a security man and has four children. The loan she hopes to get will be used to buy more foodstuffs for resale. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. She hopes to reinvest her profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy more foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity bills. 

For over twelve years, she has operated a cereal shop business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. Flora faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and purchase a taxi (motor vehicle) in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase ten bags of maize and beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Estrella's Group

texts.en:
Estrella A. is from the village of Bugallon, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Estrella is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Estrella is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector selling agricultural supplies. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling animal feed and mash to local farmers. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Estrella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Estrella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Mariana Alexandra

texts.es:
Mariana de 19 años,  es madre soltera con un niño de 1 año, tiene una pequeña papelería en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una casa que solo cuenta con luz como servicio ubicada en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín. 

Decidió aprender cómo administrar una papelería para poder mantener a su hijo. Con unos ahorros compro papelería para venderla en la parte delantera de su casa. En l actualidad tiene distribuida su propia papelería con cuadernos, plumas, laminas etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y artículos para la papelería. 

En el futuro quiere tener bien surtido de mercadería su negocio para que sus ventas se incrementen y asi poderle dar una buena vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mariana, 19, is a single mother of a one year old son.  She has a small stationery shop in the front part of her house.  She lives in a house that’s only utility is electricity located in a periurban zone called Fortín.

She decided to learn how to run a stationery shop to support her son.  She used her savings to buy stationery items to sell in the front part of her house.  She currently has her shop stocked with notebooks, pens, diagrams, etc.  She is open from 7am until 8pm every day.  She wants to use the loan to buy notebooks, pens and other stationery items.

In the future she’d like to have her store well stocked with merchandise so that sales will increase thus being able to provide her son with a good life.

loans.use: For notebooks and pens.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Greetings from Theogene in Kigali, Rwanda! Theogene is 28 years old and married.

Theogene has been a motorbike taxi driver for 6 years. He works long hours transporting people to their work places. Currently he has to rent his motorbike and he plans to use this loan to help purchase his own motorbike.  He will use any profits to help his friends and family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Positivas.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 53 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, su mamá vive con ella en su casa. El marido es médico veterinario. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, pero ella también tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y en temporadas de inicios de clases elabora y entrega uniformes a escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja con la ayuda de su mama todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, los productos de la tienda los recibe en su casa.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar hilos y otros materiales para la costura, así como también productos para surtir su tienda. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque siempre cumplen con lo que prometen. Sus sueños son tener su propia casa ya que donde vive es de su mamá.
texts.en:
The ladies of the Positive Women Community Bank meet every other week in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which for many years has been known as the city of Reales Tamarindos.

Here we find Mrs. María, who is 53 years old and involved with a man. Together they have three children who are grown and living independently. Her mother lives with her in their home. Her partner is a veterinarian. Many years ago she learned how to sew.

She has a small grocery store and also also has a small sewing shop. Many years ago she began sewing clothing, making all types of clothing based on specific orders from customers or during back-to-school season, making uniforms to sell to the local schools. She works with her mother's help from 6:00 am until 10:00 pm every day and sometimes later when she has orders to deliver. The products for her store are delivered to her house.

She will use the loan to buy thread and other sewing supplies, and also to buy products to stock her store. She is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because they always fulfill their promises. She dreams of having her own home since her current house is her mother's.

loans.use: To buy thread, buttons, zippers, groceries

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Santiago; el tiene 50 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cabina de internet y también se dedica a trabajar como profesor de un instituto, el socio trabaja en su negocio de cabinas de internet desde las 2:00 p.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de cabina de internet. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar suministros para las computadoras.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Llapanchispac Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Santiago is 50 years old, single, and has two children. He alternates his daily activities with his internet cafe business and he also works as a professor at an institute. He works at his internet cafe business from 2pm to 10pm and wants to expand this business. He is requesting the loan to purchase supplies for the computers.

Santiago is happy for the loan and promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for the computers

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia tiene 52 años de edad, está casada con el sr. Higinio Leiva hace ya 35 años, juntos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 hijos están trabajando en Brasil en un taller de costura de prendas de lencerías para damas, y otro hijo está trabajando en Argentina, y la última hija también trabaja en forma independiente en la venta de joyas de plata en la ciudad de Asunción.
La misma es costurera y también confecciona las prendas de lencería para damas, para lo cual tiene máquinas de coser. En este ramo trabajó muchos años, ella vive junto con su esposo y su hija en la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
Comenta que en este momento las ventas de las lencerías han disminuido bastante, por lo que emprendió otro negocio con la venta de platería (cadenas, anillos,pulseras, aros).
Ha retirado ya varios créditos, que le sirven mucho para su capital, dichos créditos son una herramienta muy importante para poder crecer dentro de su microempresa, y de esa forma mejorar también su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Alicia is 52 years old and has been married to Sr. Leiva for 35 years. They have four children, two of whom work in Brazil at a textile factory that makes women’s lingerie. Another child works in Argentina and the youngest daughter works independently selling silver jewelry in city of Asunción.

Alicia is a seamstress who also makes women’s lingerie garments and has sewing machines to perform her work. She lives with her husband and daughter in the city of Villa Elisa.

At the moment Alicia says that sales of lingerie have diminished significantly, so she started another business selling silver jewelry (chains, rings, bracelets, and rings). She has already taken several loans that have provided capital. The loans have been an important resource so that she can grow her small business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase silver jewelry (chains, rings, bracelets, and rings)

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Compostela, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  a general store, hog raising and motorcycle transport. Her husband Osias, who is 42 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have three children who are between 7 and 16 years old. Josefina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Josefina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,800, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use to buy stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education. Josefina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza. In 2008, Ahmad opened his own electronics store in which he fixes and sells computers. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to increase the size of his store and buy cell phones for his store. He hopes that this will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To increase the size of his store and buy cell phones for his store

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.en:
Maria Nicolasa is 31 years old, married, and has two children. One of her children is currently studying in school. Maria works as a weaver and has four years' experience in the business. She started out operating a machine but now specializes in working by hand. She hopes to one day own her own machines and have working capital for her business. 

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase land for her family. This is Maria´s second loan through ASDIR. The previous loan has been paid back in full with no problems.

loans.use: to purchase land for family use.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Fabián, natural del distrito de Santa Rosa, tiene 43 años de edad, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, esta casado con Celsa de 40 años y fruto se esa relación concibieron 02 hijas Karina de 16 años y Ana María de 13 años, juntos viven en su propia casa en el distrito de Santa Rosa. Fabián, empezó su aventura como agricultor desde muy niño en las tierras de sus padres. Su pasión  por el agro lo llevó adquirir sus propias tierras donde viene trabajando 11 años de manera independiente; en el cual viene cultivando plantas de cacao, café y hojas de coca. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos de cada producto y de esa manera logra avanzar con su trabajo. Se siente muy comprometido con su labor; porque  gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que los frutos de sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de producto vendido; cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos y las precipitaciones de las lluvias así impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo y perjudicando a los frutos de sus plantaciones. El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido. Con los 500 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Fabian is originally from the district of Santa Rosa. He is 43 years old and he is a very happy and hardworking man. He is married to Celsa who is 40 years old and their relationship produced 2 daughters, Karina, 16 years old, and Ana Maria, 13. They live together in a home that is their own in the district of Santa Rosa. Fabian started his adventure as an agriculturist since he was a boy on his parents' land. His passion for agriculture led him to acquire his own land where he has been working independently for the past 11 years. He cultivates cocoa, coffee, and coca leaves. During the harvest he has help from farm hands who can quickly harvest the product and he therefore is able to advance with his work. He feels a great sense of commitment to his work. It is thanks to his daily efforts that today he is able to enjoy the fruits that the plants give him. He has obtained good earnings for each kilogram of product he has sold. He says that the winter season is not his favorite because during those months insects and rain are in abundance and it prevents him from doing his work efficiently and the products of the plantations are damaged. 

The loan which he requests will be used to acquire cocoa plants to graft them and take full advantage of the product when the weather is better. But his priority now is to purchase new land in order to expand his plantations and to increase production. This is his eighth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is committed to make all of his payments on time, especially because he wishes to access other loans in the future. He is a very well liked member of is communal bank. With the 500 nuevos soles which he requests, he will purchase cocoa plants to graft them and to take full advantage of the good weather season.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa plants

loans.name: Dana Kerti Group

texts.en:
Jro Ayu Putu P. A. is getting a second loan from MUK. The loan will be used to buy three piglets, which will be maintained for six months. 

Because the price of the special quality of feed needed is quite expensive, Jro Ayu Putu P. A. will feed the pigs with a combination of feeds, partly the good quality feed together with various types of leaves  that she can find in her garden.

Jro Ayu Putu P. A. has a dream of developing a bigger business raising pigs. With the profits she gets, she will build an additional stall to raise more pigs.

loans.use: To buy three piglets.

loans.name: Berlita

texts.en:
Berlita is 58 years old and married with eight grown children. She and her family lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur.

To earn an income, she operates a sari-sari store and cultivates their rice fields. Her business started three years ago and provides her family with PHP 4,000 per month. Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: En una tienda del barrio donde vive, Maria Isabel vende al detal productos de la canasta familiar a todos sus vecino de un amplio sector muy cercano al liugar de su vivienda;  ella iniciò este negocio hace mas de 7 años cuando lo comprò y aunque esta ubicada en un local arrendado le ha ido muy bien y ha logrado comprar vitrinas adicionales, las cuales le ayudan a hacer una mejor exhibiciòn de sus mercancias; Su poco capital de trabajo muchas veces no le permite hacer inversiones de mercancia en volumenes y ganar descuentos, por eso busca la oportunidad de aumentar su capital de trabajo a travès de credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, el cual dirigirà a la compra de ranchos, viveres y una nueva vitrina. Su sueño es tener su propio local para ahorrarse el arriendo y generar mayores ingresos que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia, conformada por sus 3 hijos en las edades de 18 a 26, años con quienes sueña ver exitosos y son su principal motivacion en la vida.
texts.en:
María Isabel sells at retail products common to the family grocery basket in a store located in the neighborhood where she lives to her neighbors in a wide area around where she lives.

She started the business over 7 years ago when she bought it and, although it’s located in a rented space, she’s done very well and has managed to buy additional display cases which help her display her merchandise better.

Her little working capital sometimes makes it impossible for her to invest in larger volumes of merchandise and earn discounts and that’s why she’s looking for an opportunity to increase her working capital through a Kiva loan which will be her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy snacks, foodstuffs and a new display case.

Her dream is to have her own locale to save on rent and generate higher income to support her family which is composed of three children between the ages of 18 and 26; she dreams with seeing them become successful and they are her main motivators in life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, foodstuffs and a new display case.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to boost her son’s business of selling clothes. His shop is located in the market and he sells different varieties of clothing to his customers. He purchases the clothes from Multan and Faisalabad which are known for their textiles. 

Razia is the mother of two sons and both of them have the same business. Her husband is elderly and can’t work due to his older age; that’s why he spends time at home. 

Razia is confident about the positive growth of her son’s business and about the better financial future of her family as a result of a loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en: Eden is 56 years old, married and has one child. For the last 10 years, she has made a living by running a retail store where she earns PHP 4,500 a month. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, coffee and bread to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to continue to have access to credit, because this will allow her to expand her business and provide her family with daily necessities.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, coffee and bread to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jerus

texts.en:
Jerus, a 52-year-old married mother of five children, lives in the Philippines where she has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and rice by the kilogram.

In business for 12 years, she is requesting a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy snacks, sacks of rice and canned goods. A member of HSPFI since 2003, Jerus hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sacks of rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Bartazard

texts.fr:
Client de 45 ans, marie et pere de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 15 ans.En 2005 il ouvre un pressing pour laver les vetements hommes et femmes, ses revenus sont de 10.000 a 25.000 fr par jour.

A l'octroi de son pret, il va acheter des detergents de differents qualite, des sachets pour emballage, des douzaines des cintres et il est entrain d'epargner pour acheter un groupe electrogene de 3kv pour palier au probleme d'electricite.

Pour le futur il a l'intention d'ameliorer ses conditions de travail,et travailler plus qu'avant pour ouvrir un autre pressing plus moderne.
texts.en:
He is a 45 year old client who is married and father of 3 children who are between the ages of 5 and 15.In 2005 he opened a laundry for men and women’s clothes, his income is of 10.000 to 25.000 per day.

When he receives his loan he will buy different quality detergents , bags for wrapping  the clothes, dozens of clothes hangers and he is in the process of saving up to buy a 3kv generator to resolve the electricity  shortage.

In the future he aims to improve his working conditions and work more than before in order to open another, more modern laundry.

loans.use: purchase detergents of different quality,bags ,and dozens of clothes hangers.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman with five children. Three of her children are adults and two still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past six years, Rosemary has operated a business selling and distributing fresh water. She sells water from her home and also door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. Rosemary's major business challenge is transportation.

Rosemary decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting an 80,000 KES loan to purchase plumbing materials, pipes, taps, and an electric meter. In the future, Rosemary dreams of expanding her business to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing materials, pipes, taps and an electric meter

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.es:
Apolinaria, se dedica a la venta de tamales, cuajada y queso, vive con sus dos nietos, ella se dedica al negocio de varios productos, como se menciona vende tamales de pollo dos veces a la semana, cuajada y queso todos los días los vende en su vivienda.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de leche para la elaboración de queso y cuajada, también comprara pollo, aceite y maíz para la preparación de los tamales, con el financiamiento podrá tener todo lo necesario para continuar en su negocio.
