She hopes to expand her business in order to pay school fees for her three children, and to improve her lifestyle (which means having enough money for food for the family.) Someday she hopes to expand her business by preserving the milk (through refrigeration).

loans.use: purchasing milk

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 06 hijos.  Tiene estudios de primaria  completa, vive en el Comunidad de Urani Marcacollo Centro poblado de Camicachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizó para la compra de productos de la región (papa, oca, chuño). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de productos de la región (papa, quinua, chuño, ocas, etc), y ganado menor como ovinos.

Su deseo es continuar con su negocio para seguir cubriendo los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan las charlas, los ahorros y la unión que existe con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Mrs Juliana, belongs to the Communal Bank "Manuela de Hoy" which is located in the district of Ilave, Province of El Collao, Puno Department. She is 49 years old, married and a mother of 6 children. She has completed primary schooling and lives in the Community Marcacollo Urani in the town of Camicachi. She has been a member of the "Manuela Ramos" group for 3 years. Her first loan was in the amount of S /. 300.00 new soles. It was used for the purchase of local produce (potatoes, geese, potato flour). At this time she is requesting a loan in the amount of S /. 2500.00 new soles for the purchase of local produce (potatoes, quinoa, potato flour, geese, etc), and small livestock such as sheep. Her desire is to carry on with her business to continue covering family expenses. She likes the discussions, savings and fellowship that exists with her partners.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of potatoes, quinoa, potato flour, geese, etc. Purchase of small livestock (sheep)

loans.name: Зульфизар

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Зульфизар девушка 25 лет , замужем имеет одного ребёнка. Она проживает в Сомгаре , в посёлке Карочингиль. Зульфизар производит пряжу на дому, одновременно ухаживает за скотом. Сейчас у неё две коровы и бараны. На полученный кредит Зульфизар планирует с мужем, купит ещё несколько баранов и корм для них.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Progress Group

texts.en:
Comfort is 29 years old trader she is married and mother of four children. All her children are currently in school. She is a very resourceful mother whose hard effort brings livelihood to the family. She supports her husband in taking care of the family through the sale of used clothing sales. Selling of used clothing has a very big market share in Ghana as brand new cloths are very expensive for the economically active poor and has been in this business for a year now. She travels to a nearby city called Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory she normally concentrates on kid’s wear, bed sheets and used towels sales. She believes this loan would help her save for her children future and also to rent a store to trade as she sells the clothing through hawking. 

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Progress’. She is the one in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased bales of used clothing and bags charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying fertilizer

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Mrs. Sat I. lives in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Cheam Roeun, is a salt middleman. Although his business is goI. well, he faces an obstacle because he does not have a motorbike to transport his goods. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sat I. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savI. to buy a motorbike to transport the salts to sell. She is 50 years old and the mother of children who are employed in a garment factory. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To add to her saving to buy a motorbike

loans.name: God Answer Prayer Group

texts.en:
God Answer prayer is a group of 4 borrowers which is led by Saysay B.. Saysay is a 42-year-old married man with 8 children between the ages of 1 and 24 years old (and their educational levels are between kindergarten and 11th grade). He is a high school graduate, but he could not continue on to university due to a lack of financial support. Saysay and his family live in the sheriff Quarter, a large Muslim community in Voinjama, the capital of Lofa county in northern Liberia.

Saysay is engaged in the business of selling used clothing. Specifically, he buys used clothes wholesale and then sells the clothes in the main market of Voinjama. He has been operating this business for 4 years, and he is hoping to improve the business in coming months. He explains that he serves his customers in a humble fashion and that he talks to his customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue to purchase from him.

Because Saysay has to support his family and because he is always striving to improve his family's standard of living, he takes his business very seriously. He needs this loan in order to purchase more used clothing at wholesale prices in order to improve the business. Saysay dreams of giving his children a better education.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Mr. Kha Roeng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Kha R. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a fisherman. He is 34 years old and the father of two children who are attending the local school. His wife, Mrs. Heng Tho, is employed in a garment factory. In his fishery, he faces an obstacle because he does not have fishnets which is affecting his income. Thus, he decided to request a loan to buy more fishnets for his fishery. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's life with this loan.

Mr. Kha R. is the president of this village bank which consists of 14 people located in Prek Reang village in Kandal province. The members will use the loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets for his fishery

loans.name: Burkhon

texts.en:
Burkhon M. is a 25-year-old young man who dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus. He is not married, but the need for an additional source of income for his large family forced him to start his own business. Burkhon has about two years of experience in the public transportation field. Demands for his service are rather high since there are so many people who need it.

Burkhon must maintain his vehicle since this is the tool of his trade. So now Burkhon is counting on your help. He is requesting a loan of $3000 USD to purchase spare parts and winter tires for his microbus. With your support, Burkhon will continue to prosper in his business and so support his brother and sister in their education.

About Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture and new Western cultures and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war that ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

About IMON International:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spare parts and winter tires to maintain his microbus.

loans.name: Yabana

texts.en:
Yabana E. sells beer in a bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell. Yabana is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 6 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Bernardo Calab

texts.pt:
Bernardo Calab Botão M. nasceu na cidade da Beira, Província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique, tem 46 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 17, 14, 09, 06 e 01 anos de idade, destes os dois últimos não estudam. Fez 10ª classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa dos serviços com sua família e ainda sustenta a sua mãe na Beira enviando dinheiro.

Saiu da Beira para Maputo afim de dar continuidade com os seus estudos em 1982 e acabou fixando sua residência. Trabalha no I.P.U a mais de 21 anos, como motorista e mecânico num horário único das 7:30h as 15:30h. Tem um salário mensal de 2.500.00mt e 2.000.00mt através de prestação de serviços aos terceiros. Este aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária. 

Nunca teve empréstimos em bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes, chapas, cimento, ferro, areia e janelas) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 13.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
 
 Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência, sair da casa dos serviços e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Bernardo Calab Botão M. was born in the city of Beira, Sofala Province, in central Mozambique. He is 46 years old, married, and the father of 5 children who are 17, 14, 9, 6, and 1 years old. The youngest two children don't go to school. He only studied through 10th grade due to lack of funds. He lives in the service worker houses with his family and even supports his mother in Beira by sending money. He left Beira for Maputo in order to continue with his studies in 1982 and ended up making a home there. He has worked for the I.P.U. (Inter-Parliamentary Union) for more than 21 years as a driver and mechanic. His working schedule is from 7:30am to 3:30pm. He receives a monthly salary of 2,500 MZN and receives 2,000 MZN for services for third parties. He uses this for household expenses and even saves some in his bank account. He has never had loans through banks. He found out about Hluvuku through service colleagues who are also clients of this institution. This is his 4th loan, which has a value of 15,000 MZN. He plans to use this to buy construction materials (beams, panes, cement, steel, sand, and windows) in order to continue to build his home. The previous loans were for 6,000 MZN, 10,000 MZN, and 13,000 MZN, all for the same purpose. In the future, he would like to ask for more loans in order to continue to build his home, move out of the service worker houses, and provide better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, steel, etc.)

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Alberta es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Alberta es soltera, tiene 41 años y 2 hijos, Alberta vende ropa y zapatos a pedido, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y conocidos, sus ventas son al crédito. Además en época de cosecha hace papa seca en su casa.
Alberta necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa variada.
Alberta sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos fuera de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Alberta, 41, is a member of the Amauta Huamanga communal bank. She is single and has 2 children. Alberta sells clothing and shoes on order to her friends and acquaintances; her sales are on credit. In addition, at harvest time, she prepares dehydrated potato in her home. Alberta needs a 3000 sol loan to buy assorted clothing. Alberta dreams with providing her children with a good education outside of the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted articles of clothing.

loans.name: Aydalina

texts.es:
La Sra. Aydalina B. trabaja en la alcaldía municipal tiene dos años para elaborar para esta institución de conserje,  solicita el crédito para completar la compra de materiales como arena, cemento y hierro para hacer un cuarto a unos de sus bebe. Es el Segundo Crédito  con Ceprodel lo cual  le va a ayudar mucho ya que solo así  podría terminar la construcción de su cuarto por que tiene un salario muy bajo.
Tiene un hijo en edad escolar, ella es casada su esposo trabaja en el minsa (centro de salud)
texts.en:
Senora Aydalina has worked for the municipal mayor's office for 2 years for the custodial department. She is requesting a loan to complete the purchase of materials such as sand, cement and iron to build a room for a baby. This is her second loan through Ceprodel, it will greatly help her as this is the only way she will be able to complete the construction of her room since she has a small salary. She has one school-age son, she is married and her husband works in El Minsa Health Center.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Parum

texts.en: Parum S. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Parum is 30 years old and is married to a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a big shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Galibat

texts.fr: A. Y. Galibat est née le 20 novembre 1965.  Il y a six ans que Galibat s’est installée au quartier Sodjèatinme à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Galibat est mariée à JONHSON Edouard et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés.  Galibat vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Galibat a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Galibat vend des valises et des sacs de voyage à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Galibat a huit ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et s’approvisionne au Ghana, pays voisin du Bénin. Galibat a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé.  Galibat sollicite un deuxième crédit pour renforcer son activité et multiplier son profit.
texts.en:
Galibat Akangba Y. was born November 20 1965. For the last six years she has lived in the Sodjèatinme neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She is married to Edouard Jonhson, and has three children, all of them educated, and lives with her husband and children. Together, she and her husband take care of household expenses. She left school after the secondary course. To meet her needs, she sells suitcases and travel bags at Dantokpa, Bénin's international marketplace. She has eight years' experience in this field. She buys her merchandise in Ghana, a neighboring country. She has fully repaid one loan from ALIDé. She has applied for a second loan to grow her business and increase her profit.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of suitcases

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 33 años y no tiene hijos. Presenta Estudios Superiores de Laboratorio Clínico.

Amparo, se dedica a la venta de Comidas Preparadas cómo; arroz chaufa, Juanes, tamalitos, empanadas; dulces y golosinas; chifles, y en bebidas como: gaseosas, refrescos y jugos Refrigerios, se inicio hace 5 años, ubicada en su misma casa un lugar amplio y acondicionado, exclusivamente para que acudan sus clientes a diario, se inicio con un capital de 300 Nuevos Soles, comprando su licuadora, vasos, platos, cubiertos, etc. Así empezó comprando para empezar con su negocio, ahora es conocida y tiene clientela fijas, vecinos, familiares, moradores, etc. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio donde vende sus comidas. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de sus refrigerios cómo: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, yuca y papa en sacos, plátano en racimos y frutas de la región para la preparación de sus jugos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Amparo esta contenta con el trabajo que realiza día a día,  se siente con muchas fuerzas aun para seguir adelante y con sus ventas de refrigerios. Agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de crecer como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Amparo, 33, is a member of the “Sargento Lores” (Sargeant Lores) communal bank, which is located in Morales, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is single and has no children; she completed superior education as a Laboratory Technician. Amparo sells prepared meals like: arroz chaufa (Chinese style rice), Juanes (rice, chicken, egg and olives), tamalitos (tamales), empanadas (turnovers), candy, snacks, fried banana chips and beverages: soft-drinks, fruit juices, etc. She began this work 5 years ago in her own home in a spacious and well-equipped area that is for the exclusive use of her daily customers. She started out with a 300 new sol investment that she used to buy blenders, drinking glasses, cutlery, etc. This is how she started buying items for her business. Now, she is well-known and has regular customers, who are her neighbors, relatives, residents, etc. She still continues with the same business where she sells her meals. She will use this 1,000.00 new sol loan to buy ingredients for her dishes, such as: sacks of rice and sugar, crates of chickens and eggs, sacks of potatoes and manioc, bunches of bananas and regional fruit for her beverages, as well as eating utensils to provide better customer service. Amparo is happy with the work she does every day; she feels strong to continue selling her refreshments. She is quite grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for giving her the opportunity to grow as a woman and small businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meals preparation.

loans.name: Satikulova Muhabbatkhan's Group

texts.ru:
Мухаббатхан, 41, замужем и воспитывает 3 детей. Ее супруг находится на заработках в РФ. Клиент сама работает учительницей начальных классов в школе Узгена. Кроме этого она дома занимается откормом живности. Кредит запрашивается для закупа 1 коровы и дальнейшей отправки на пастбище. Обычно живность продается в конце осени с определенной прибылью. 

Равзахан 28 лет. Она замужем. Ее супруг работает в собственной столовой в Узгене, в основном приготавливает шашлыки. Сама же клиентка занимается оптовой торговлей потребительских товаров, а также кондитерских изделий. Этим бизнесом она занимается с 1995 года. Кредит будет направлен для закупа 50 кг печений, 100 кг конфет и 40 кг пряников. 

Азизбеку 24 года. Он холост и живет вместе с родителями в собственном доме. Клиент работает частным строителем по УЗгену. Кредит запрашивается для закупа стройматериалов для ремонта дома. 

Рахбархан, 36, замужем. У нее 4 детей: 3 сына и 1 дочь. Старшие двое сыновей учатся в школе. Ее супруг работает телемастером. Рахбархан занимается торговлей посуды и производственными товарами. Бизнес был начат 4 года назад по рекомендации соседки. Кредит нужен для закупа посуды в целях расширения ассортимента. 
  
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Muhabbatkhan is 41 years old, married and raising three children. Her husband now works in the Russian Federation. She works as a teacher of elementary grades in the school of Uzgen. Besides that she also feeds and grows cattle at home. She is asking for the loan to buy one cow for grazing. Usually the cattle sells at the end of autumn for a particular profit. Ravzahan is 28 years old. She is married. Her husband works in his own cafe in Uzgen, he makes mainly shishkabobs. She is in the wholesale of household goods and also confections. She has been in this business since 1995. The loan will be used towards the purchase of 50 kilograms of baked cookies, 100 kilograms of candy and 40 kg of gingerbread cakes. Azizbek is 24 years old. He is a bachelor and lives with his parents in their own home. He works as a freelance construction worker in Uzgen. He is asking for the loan to buy building materials for the repair of a house. Rahbarhan is 36, she is married. She has four children: three sons and one daughter. Two older sons go to school. Her husband works as a TV repairman. Rahbarhan sells china and other products. She started this business four years ago by taking her neighbor's recommendation. She needs the loan to buy china to expand the variety of her merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one cow, confections, building materials, china

loans.name: Edwin Grover

texts.es:
El señor Grover H. O. es un señor de 41 años, casado con 2 hijos de 13 y 15 años, viven en la zona Sarcobamba, de la Provincia Cercado. Grover se encuentra casado con la señora Teodora Menacho.

Grover trabaja  como distribuidor de productos para ferretería, el se encarga de buscarse clientes y después de reunir un pedido considerable, realiza su orden de pedido a la Ciudad de La Paz, y luego Grover distribuye todos sus pedidos, hay meses donde sus pedidos son altos, pero hay meses que a pesar de su esfuerzo no logra cubrir sus necesidades, entonces con ayuda de su vehículo trabaja como chofer de taxi, de ese modo logra levar el sustento a su hogar. La señora Teodora también trabaja, vendiendo perfumes. Los señores son personas muy dedicadas a su trabajo, y tienen un sueño que su hijo menor estudie una carrera militar aunque aún le falta 4 años más para terminar el colegio ellos saben que necesitan ahorrar para cuando llegue ese momento, es por eso que en este momento es donde más están trabajando más.

El señor Grover se apersono buscando un financiamiento para la adquisición mas mercadería, si bien aún no ha podido crear una agencia porque necesitaría mayor capital y más clientes, con el pasar de los años lograra  tener su propia tienda de distribución.
texts.en:
Grover H. O. is a man of 41 years of age, and is married with 2 children, 13 and 15. He lives in the Sarcobamba zone, Cercado province. Grover is married to Teodora Menacho. Grover works as a hardware distributor. He is in charge of looking for clients and taking their orders. After he has gathered a large number of orders, he places his order in La Paz city, and later distributes his client's orders. There are months when orders are high, but there are also months when, despite his hard work, he doesn't manage to cover living necessities. So, with the help of his vehicle, he also works as a taxi driver, and in this way manages to sustain his home. Teodora also works selling perfumes. The couple are very dedicated to their work, and their biggest dream is that their youngest son studies a military career. Even though he has 4 years left at school they realise that they need to save for when this moment arrives, and it is because of this they are working so much now. Grover took charge of looking for finance to acquire more merchandise, as he hasn't been able to create an distribution agency yet as he needs more capital and clients. With the passing of years he will achieve having his own distribution warehouse.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase inventory

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface N. N. is 33 years old, single and runs a business located at Ziwani, a residential area in the town of Thika, Kenya. This region is best known for the production of pineapples, and for the last year he has made a living selling detergents, soft drinks, candles and others items to people in his area. He says that business is profitable and the only problem he has is lack of enough stock. To help solve this problem, he has applied for a loan of Kes 30,000 to restock and expand his store. He hopes to get married and have children some day, and also to go into business as a wholesaler. He is very hardworking, ambitious and well-liked.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Guissela Ivania

texts.es: Guisela es una señora de 39 años de edad, madre de tres hijos estudiantes que junto a su esposo trabajan para lograr una mejor economía. Su esposo ya esta en el país y trabaja como conductor con los ahorros que trajo de su trabajo en el extranjero logro hacer mejoras a su casa. Doña Guisela se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, pues anteriormente vendía ropa de segunda mano, cuajada, y leche que le dan unas vacas que tiene y así se ayuda para pagar gastos básicos. Con este crédito comprara: ropa para dama, caballero, niños para aumentar las ventas y la captación de clientes nuevos. contenta por su pequeño negocio ya que esta logrando la inversión y se siente útil  para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Guisela, 39, and her husband have three children who are students; she and her husband work in order to have an improved economic status. Her husband is back in the country and works as a driver; he used savings he was able to acquire abroad to make some home improvements. Guisela sells new clothes; she used to sell used clothing, cuajada (a cheese-like product) and milk from a few cows she has thus helping to meet basic expenses. She will use this loan to buy clothing for women, men and children to increase her sales and acquire new customers.. She is happy with her small business because she's recovering her investment and she feels she's doing something useful for her family's wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for women, men and children to increase sales and win over more customers.

loans.name: Orm

texts.en: S., 51 years old, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, Cambodia, where she owns and farms a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She plants her crops twice a year, and she was taught how to grow rice by her grandfather. She is a good mother and has two children. One child is married and lives away from home, while the other one works on the farm. Her husband appears on the left of the photo and raises ducks.  He breeds ducks for eggs. As the duck raising trade is very profitable, S. is taking out this loan to buy more ducklings to raise.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings to raise

loans.name: Brak

texts.en:
Brak P., 56, is married and resides with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. P. is a farmer, growing rice for an income of USD 0.50 per day. Her husband is a priest, earning an income of about USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

P. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for their child to commute to school. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for their child's transport

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells cassava, plantain and palm fruit at Elmina. Ama has no educational background.  She is divorced and has six dependants. Ama has been selling foodstuffs for 30 years. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en: Florentina M. is from the town of Villa Rose Cabarroguis, Quirino. She is 40 years old. Florentina is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Florentina makes and sells charcoal. Florentina has worked in the charcoal business for over a year and earns approximately 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Florentina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florentina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the second loan taken out by Florentina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun N., 48, is married and lives with four of her children in Takeo province. She and her husband work together making cow roofs, typically earning about $3.30 US each day and they are also supported by one child working in a garment factory. The family spends about $45 US on food, $5 US on utilities, $40 US on transportation and $40 US on other expenses. Since the family spends so much on transportation, Hun N. is asking for a loan of $1000 US to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Kembang Kertas Group

texts.en: Ni Nengah Suharini is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of this ten-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Kembang Kertas (PK-10303). Ni Nengah is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month. In 2010, Ni Nengah joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her first from MUK. Ni Nengah plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** Ni Nengah Suharini (0) merupakan 32 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Nengah adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Kembang Kertas (PK-10303). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Nengah sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Nengah menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Ni Nengah bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Nengah meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Leoncita

texts.en: Leoncita P.'s main source of income comes from providing general alterations and tailoring services in her community. She is 55 years old, married and has five adult children. She is from the village of Villa Verde, Iligan City. Leoncita has been in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Leoncita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Leoncita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia A. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 44 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Cynthia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food & daily use products. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month..

In 2010, Cynthia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cynthia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es:
María de 47 años, elabora y vende zapatillas con sus hijos de 17, 16, 15, 12 y 10 años ellos viven en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado porque la mayor parte de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Hace un año le dieron una liquidación de trabajo a uno de sus hijos con ese dinero compro algunos materiales para hacer zapatillas y venderlas al por mayor, Ella y sus hijos cuando salen del colegio cosen y pegan zapatillas para venderlas a las tiendas desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm. Cada zapatilla de mujer la venden a $ 25.00, y las de hombre a $ 30.00 c/u.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tiras y plantas de zapatillas para su elaboración. En el futuro quiere tener una microempresa de entrega de zapatillas.
texts.en:
María, forty-seven, makes and sells sandals with her children, who are seventeen, sixteen, fifteen, twelve, and ten-years-old.  They live in Guasmo de Guayaquil (characterized primarily by its population of informal merchants).  

A year ago one of her children got a severance package from work, and used the money to buy some supplies for making sandals to sell wholesale.  When the children get out of school, they and María sew and glue the sandals so they can be sold at the stores between 8AM and 5PM.  The women's sandals sell for $25.00 and the men's for $30.00.

María wants to use her loan to buy straps and soles.  In the future she would like to have a small sandal shipping business.

loans.use:
Tiras, plantas de zandalias 
Sandle straps and soles.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 24 años es una joven madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. En los verdes campos del poblado de Cochayoc (Distrito de la provincia de Tarma), Margarita tiene sus cultivos de papa y arveja. Todas las mañanas sin importarle las condiciones del clima sale a trabajar sus tierras, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y aún sigue cuidando sus plantaciones de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Margarita, 24, is a young, unassuming, hard working mother.  She lives in her own house and what she most desires is to improve her quality of life.  Margarita farms potatoes and peas in the green countryside of Cochayoc, a district in Tarma province.  Every morning, regardless of weather conditions, she goes out to work her fields because this is her family’s sole source of income.

What she enjoys the most about the work is cultivating the land, something she does with much dedication.  She has been farming for 4 years and continues caring for her crops keeping them safe from insect infestations.  In time she’d like to buy more land to increase production.

This is her 8th loan with MFP and she is saving up in order to repay on time because she does not want to cause any problems for the members of her communal bank where she feels very happy.

She will use the requested 1200 new soles to buy more manure and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Batzaya

texts.en: Batzaya B. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and son in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. He has been operating a transportation business, using his own big truck, since 2010. He began his business in 2010 after working as a driver in the military army. After many years of owning this business, he has gained much experience. For the future, he is planning to improve his truck. Batzaya is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more coal to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more coal

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania tiene 63 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sembrando maíz, producto que cuida con mucho cuidado, para tener una buena cosecha. Por otro lado también se dedica en la venta D. productos lácteos como quesos, asimismo venD. tamales que lleva periódicamente a sus clientes que viven lejos D. su zona. Ambas actividades le generan ganancias que le permiten sostenerse económicamente. Por ello desea producir en mayor cantidad y vender para aumentar sus ganancias. Es el crédito número 2 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono para la siembra D. maíz.
texts.en:
Epifania is 63 years old and lives with her husband in her own home.  She has always been involved in growing corn, even since childhood, and takes great care to obtain a good crop.  She also sells dairy products, such as cheese, and tamales which she delivers to her customers living in the area.

Both activities have allowed her to support herself financially, so her aim is to increase production, sales and profits.  

This is the second loan from MFP.  She is happy knowing she has this financial support, and being a part of the communal bank because its members are people she knows who are dependable and supportive.  She expresses her gratituD. to any possible lenders as they will enable her to develop her business.  She plans to invest the loan in sacks of fertilizer for her corn crop.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a young man from Tulkarem City. Haitham is a police man. Haitham started furnishing his house and he had to borrow $1,100 from friends and relatives to finish furnishing. Haitham came to FATEN and took a loan to pay back his friends and relatives.

Haitham is a an ambitious man and a very good reputation police man. Haitham appears in the picture above in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To pay for house furniture expenses

loans.name: 23 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “23 de Julio” iniciará el ciclo número nueve en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la banca comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva compuesta por una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: Kiosco de dulces, venta de refrescos, comercio y reparto de víveres, venta de dulces y refrescos, venta de ganado, venta de productos AVON, elaboración de Cotillón, bordados.

En el caso de la señora  Fanny, presidenta de la banca comunal, ella tiene como negocio  la venta de cotillón,  hace seis años aprendió de su cuñada y desde ese entonces ella viaja a la población de Desaguadero para traer mercadería y la vende en la ciudad de La Paz, en un lugar comercial llamado “La Tablada”, vende todos los días desde las diez de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche.  Este lugar de venta es muy concurrido por la población porque se conoce que es muy económico.  La señora Fanny cuenta con el apoyo de su cuñado, que le reemplaza en la atención del puesto cuando es necesario.
La señora Fanny es una persona emprendedora, a sus veintinueve años, además de contar con este negocio es esposa y madre de tres niños.

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde “el crédito”.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “23 de Julio” (23rd of July) will begin its ninth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada.  The group consists of eight members and is directed by an executive council made up of the president, treasurer, and secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied: candy stand, selling refreshments, selling and repairing homes, selling candy and beverages, selling cattle, selling AVON products, making party supplies, embroidery.

In the case of Fanny, president of the Communal Bank, she has as a business selling party supplies. 6 years ago she learned this business from her brother-in-law and since then she travels to Desaguadero to bring merchandise and sells it in the city of La Paz, in a commercial location called “La Tablada.” She sells every day from ten in the morning until eight at night. This location is highly frequented by shoppers as it is known as being inexpensive. Fanny counts on her brother-in-law’s support, as he helps her sell when she needs it.

Fanny is a very entrepreneurial person at her 29 years of age, in addition to her business she is a wife and mother of three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds, “the loan.”

loans.use: Buy party supplies

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Con herramienta prestada y con la esperanza de hacer de su taller de mecánica un negocio próspero, desde hace 17 años, Guillermo B. C., empezó con su negocio, el cual ha sido la fuente de sustento para él y su familia conformada por tres hijos. 

Ofrecerle educación superior a su hija menor, es el sueño de Guillermo y para lograrlo requiere que su negocio permanezca en el tiempo, pues así podrá contar con los ingresos que puedan hacer de este sueño una realidad. Actualmente este emprendedor requiere de un préstamo para la adquisición de herramientas que le permitirán agilizar el proceso del montaje de las llantas, así logrará atender mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Seventeen years ago, Guillermo B. C. started his business with borrowed equipment and the hope of making his repair shop successful. This business is the means by which he supports himself and his family, which includes three children.

Guillermo dreams of providing his youngest daughter with a higher education. In order to do this, he must keep his business in operation so that he will have the income to make this dream a reality. This entrepreneur currently needs a loan to acquire equipment that will enable him to streamline the process of mounting tires and provide high quality service to his customers.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for mounting tires

loans.name: 15 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal”15 de Agosto”, es un grupo de 8 personas, 7 mujeres y un varón, decidieron unirse para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Esta Banca Comunal es parte del centro focal de Cascada, están iniciando su ciclo número diez.
Cada una de ellas tienen negocios propios, de diferentes tipos, como ser: venta ambulante de verduras, artesanía – hilados, costura de deportivos, artesanía de macramé, Internet, venta de ropa, servicio de pensión.

Para su organización, la “B. C.  15 de Agosto” cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Edna, una tesorera, la señora  Isidora y una secretaria de actas, la señora Marina.
 
La Presidenta, la señora Edna, es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con sus tres hijos.   El negocio de la señora Edna  es artesanía de cadenas de oro, ella comenta que inicio el negocio con una amiga hace ocho años.
Actualmente compra el oro de una empresa y elabora las artesanías a pedido.

La señora presidenta está ingresando como cliente a Pro Mujer por primera vez, cuando se le consulta que es lo que le gusta de la institución, ella responde la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “15 de Agosto” (August 15) communal bank has 8 members: 7 women and one man.  They decided to join together to seek credit, training and health services.  This communal bank is part of the Cascada focal center.  They are starting cycle #10.

Each member has her own different type of business, such as: vegetable street vendor, woven crafts, sportswear making, macramé crafts, Internet, clothing sales and daily meal services.

For its organization, the 15 de Agosto communal bank has a governing board composed of a President, Edna, a Treasurer, Isidora, and a Recording Secretary, Marina.

The President, Edna, is a 29 year old woman living with her three children.  Her business is gold chain crafts.  She comments that she started the business with a girl friend 8 years ago.  She buys the gold from a firm and makes crafts on order.

Madame President is joining Pro Mujer as a client for the first time.  When she is asked what she likes best about the institution she answers: the training.

loans.use: To buy raw material: gold.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla S. is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Perla owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling vegetables such as onion springs and spices, in the local community. Perla has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Perla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Perla is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Perla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza P. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is 33 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Analiza owns and operates a motor transport service. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Analiza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Analiza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe P. Y. tiene 58 años, es viuda vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se reúnen en la ciudadela 24 de Mayto está ventanilla se dedica a actividades comerciales como la vetan de perfumes, ropa, bisutería y otros son comerciantes de carne.

Maria Guadalupe se dedica a la a la venta de comida en un comedor las compras las realiza en el mercado de Ventanas y las vente en su comedir todos los días. 

Solicita el crédito para ampliar su negocio en  adecuar su local. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y los precios altos. Su sueño es tener una economía estable

Le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe P. Y. is 58 years old, widowed, and lives with her children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.  She has two children.

The members of the community bank ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA [Tomorrow's Success] are located in the Ventanas canton and meet in the 24 de Mayto neighborhood.  The group members work in different retail activities, like sales of perfumes, clothing, jewelry, and meat.

Maria Guadalupe sells food in a cafeteria.  She purchases food at the market in Ventanas and sells it at her cafeteria every day.  

She is asking for this loan to expand her business and improve her premises.  The support of the loan will help her meet her needs financially.  She encounters challenges like competition and high prices.  Her dream is to have stable finances.

She likes to watch television.

loans.use: to expand and improve her cafeteria.

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
El señor José Raúl G. y su esposa la señora Vicenta Margarita Sánchez tiene ya mas de cinco años dedicándose a la venta de ropa nueva y usada en diferentes partes de la ciudad, ellos atiende al negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para darles lo necesario a sus hijos y tenga una buena educación. 
Están solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía, de juguetes, zapatos y accesorios para bebes. Ya que en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para invertir en el negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene del negocio, ya que con esta nueva inversión tendrán más ventas.
texts.en:
José Raúl G. and his wife, Vicenta Margarita Sánchez, have been selling new and used clothing in different parts of the city for more than five years.  Their business is the source of income which they use to support their children and provide them with a good education.  

José is requesting a loan so that they can buy merchandise - toys, shoes and baby accessories - as, right now, they don't have the capital they need to invest in their business.  José plans to repay his loan with some of the profits that he makes in his business since they will make more sales thanks to this new investment.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Aydin

texts.ru: Aydin M. rodilsya v 1988 qodu. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Aydin projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. U Aydina semya bednaya i on starayetsya rabotat mnoqo chtobi pomogat semye. Mladshaya sestra Aydina uchitsya v kolledje, yeyo uchebu toje oplachivayet Aydin. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye zapchasti dlya toqo chtobi pochinit svoyu mahsinu. On uje 3 qoda kak rabotayet taxistom. U neqo mahsina staraya i poetomu chasto nujdayetsya v pochinke , a koqda mashina ne rabotayet on ne mojet zarabativat dostatochno dlya pomoshi svoyey semye.
texts.en: Aydin M. was born in 1988. He is not married and doesn't have children. Aydin lives in the Absheron region together with his family. Aydin's family is poor and he tries to work a lot to help his family. His younger sister is studying in college, Aydin pays for her tuition too. At this time he needs 2300 AZN to buy necessary spare parts to fix his car. He has been working as a taxi driver for three years. His car is old and needs to be repaired often, because when his car is not working he cannot make enough money to help his family.

loans.use: to buy necessary spare parts for the car

loans.name: Giancarlos

texts.es:
Giancarlos  de 35 años  es un hombre que se ha  dedicado a la actividad comercial para generar ingresos  con tal de lograr estudiar y prepararse para el futuro;  el comenzó vendiendo algunos artículos a los compañeros de estudio,  con lo cual le generó sus primeros ingresos y desde ese momento no se ha detenido;  en la Universidad muchos estudiantes  lo reconocen y   lo buscan para hacerle encargos de mercancías que él les provisiona mediante  el sistema de créditos.
Su meta más adelante es ensanchar su  negocio en un punto comercial muy traficado y lograr comprar su propia casa para adecuar instalaciones con este propósito. Mientras se cumplen sus sueños él continua siendo un estudiante trabajador, que se esfuerza por lograr un futuro exitoso  a través de su negocio que hoy le representa  una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menores del  28%.
En la actualidad ha solicitado su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual  comprará nuevos productos en mayor volumen, como calzado y ropa femenina, paravenderlos aprovechando que se acerca el dia de las madres y ha recibido muchos pedidos para agasajar ese ser incondicional; con ello asegura una inversión exitosa pues además de ganar descuentos en las compras de contado y por volumenes, tien asegurada su venta pues esta es una mercancia con la que responderá a pedidos de sus clientes, además de lograr incrementar su capital de trabajo mediante su credikiva.
texts.en:
Giancarlos, 35, is a man who has dedicated himself to commercial activities in order to earn income to study and prepare himself for the future.  He started out selling a few items to his classmates which generated his first income and from then on he hasn’t stopped.  Many students recognize him at the university and seek him out to order merchandise that he provides for them on credit.  

His goal is to expand the business at a heavily trafficked commercial spot and to buy a house of his own to furbish for this purpose.  While his dreams come true he continues being a hard working student who strives to attain a successful future through his business which today is generating a profit margin of no less than 28%.

He is asking for his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to buy large amounts of new products, like footwear and women’s clothes, to sell taking advantage of the fact that Mothers Day is approaching and he’s gotten many orders for gifts to regale such an unconditional being.  With that he is assured of a successful investment because besides getting discounts for paying cash and for buying in quantity, his sales are assured because this is merchandise that will meet his customers’ requests as well as attaining an increase in working capital through is Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy large amounts of new products like footwear and women's clothes.

loans.name: Segundo José

texts.es:
Segundo José tiene 60 años, es viudo vive con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

Segundo José se dedica a la agricultura siembra de trigo y maíz y ganadería tiene 7 cabezas de vacas lecheras. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

Le gusta ver televisión
texts.en:
Segundo Jose is 60 years old, a widow, and he lives with his children in the Canton of Guaranda, in the province of Bolivar. He has 3 children. 

The members of the communal bank "Grupo Nucanchi Kawsay" live in the community of El Rayo of the Guanujo district in the Guaranda canton. It is at a distance of 25 minutes from the Cooperative office. They have different businesses, such as: agriculture, farming, commerce, livestock, construction work, and saw mill. 

Segundo Jose is in agriculture and he cultivates wheat and corn. He is also in farming and he has 7 dairy cows. He makes his purchases at the market in Guaranda and he makes his sales at the wholesalers' market in the same city. 


He requests a loan to purchase agricultural products and livestock feed. With the help of his loan he will be able to financially supply for his needs and he will be able to face challenges such as plagues, diseases, and the changing climate. His dream is to purchase farm land.

He enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products and livestock feed.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Álvaro es una persona muy conocida  en la comunidad de la Garita  de Guanacaste.
El tuvo un sueño desde niño y era tener su propio de negocio de tapicería. Hace poco logró  alcanzar su sueño, y hoy es dueño de  una de las empresas más importantes de la comunidad.
Su taller de tapicería ha sido un éxito y es por eso que necesita   ampliar su negocio y a mejorar su servicio cada vez más. Es por eso que el solicita un préstamo de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de Esponjas, telas para sillones, clavos y demás materiales que necesita para su taller.
Esta feliz porque este negocio le ha permitido trabajar con la familia y pasar más tiempo con ellos. 
Alvaro es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Álvaro is a very well-known member of the community of la Garita de Guanacaste.
Since he was a child, he dreamt of running his own upholstery workshop, and recently he has succeeded in making his dream come true: today, he is the owner of one of the most important companies of his community.
His upholstery workshop has been very successful, and for this reason he needs to expand his shop and improve his service even more. This is why he is requesting a loan of 500000 CRC to buy pieces of foam, fabric for armchairs, nails and other materials he needs for his shop.
He is very happy because he engages in this activity with his family, which allows him to spend more time with them.
Álvaro is a member of Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita, one of the 110 companies associated with EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy pieces of foam and fabric for armchairs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and two young children who are still attending school. She has more than 11 years of experience as a tailor. 

In 2005, she opened a curtain store where she started to produce a wide variety of drape designs. She has been running a business in order to help her husband with the household expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store's inventory. She reports that the extra purchases will enable her to serve more customers which will bring her higher profits. She hopes to be able to open a new branch of her shop in the coming year.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
45-year-old Leonila has had a flower business for 17 years now. She is a widow and a mother of four school-aged dependents. Leonila has a flower business as a blessing of nature because of their beautiful colors and pleasant scent. She plants and sells flowers like red roses, chrysanthemums, asters and anthuriums. She plants and sells flowers to earn PHP 9,150 every month. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer.

Leonila has been member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Leonila hopes to buy a hectare of land for a flower plantation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria Del Carmen tiene 39 años, vive en con sus dos hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Maria posee un negocio que es una pulpería, cuenta con gran afluencia de clientes debido a la buena calidad de servicio que ella viene ofreciendo desde hace 8 años, además existe variedad en cuanto a los productos que su tienda posee. Ella desea invertir en su negocio en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, pan, jugos, enlatados y sopas.
texts.en: Maria del Carmen is 39 years old. She lives with her two young children who are dependent on her. She has a small grocery store. Her customers speak of her with great esteem. For the past eight years she has offered them good service. She also offers a great variety of products at her store. She would like to invest in her business by buying basic food supplies such as hard candies, bread, juice, canned goods and soups.

loans.use: to buy basic food supplies such as candy, bread, juice, canned goods and soups.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam lives in Kampong Chhnang province.  She is married and has seven children.   Two are single and five are married.  

To earn a living, Mrs. Sam sells rice soup in the busy market.  Her husband, who is a pig breeder, supports the family as well by raising pigs for slaughter.  The family typically earns about $3.5 per day.  Mrs. Sam would like to take out a loan to help her husband purchase two sows to raise and sell for slaughter.  She will use the remainder of the loan to mend her broken house.  

Mrs. Sam’s family currently lives in a thatched house, but if she and her husband can increase their income, they hope to build a wooden house that will be more protected from flooding.

loans.use: to purchase two sows and repair her broken house.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: Yadira con su anterior credikiva compró cosméticos, colonias cremas, perfumes, que vendió y generó un nuevo capital de trabajo. Hoy planea aplicar a su segundo credikiva porque,  quiere comprar nuevas mercancías como paraguas, drogas naturales entre otros productos, que traen revistas especializadas a unos muy buenos precios, con lo que proyecta impactar su mercado.  Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Muchas gracias por su ayuda, sigan ayudándonos para que Dios los siga bendiciendo” Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Yadira ingrese al siguiente enlace:  http://kiva.org/lend/235197
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan Yadira purchased cosmetics, colognes, creams and perfumes which she sold to generate new working capital. 

Today she plans to apply for her second Kiva loan because she wants to buy new merchandise such as umbrellas and natural medicines, among other products shown in specialized magazines for very good prices, which she expects will make an impact on her market. She sent the following message to her Kiva lenders: "Thank you very much for your help. Keep helping us, so God will continue to bless you." If you would like to know Yadira's story, follow this link: 

http://kiva.org/lend/235197

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise such as umbrellas and natural medicines among other products.

loans.name: Halimatu

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Halimatu. She is married and has 3 children ages 15, 12 and 9 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she is her friend’s daughter from the village. In 2001, Halimatu established her provision shop business. She began her business because she gained experience from her husband and the two decided that she should start her own business in a new location. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Halimatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional provisions such as sugar, sardines, margarine, milk, tea and coffee for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Halimatu plans to build a house of her own. Halimatu was much excited about her previous loan because it helped her to increase her sales and get more customers.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional provision such as sugar, sardines, margarine, milk, tea and coffee for her business.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 20 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Flor tiene como actividad laboral la elaboración de bordados de sábanas y manteles con máquina de coser, también ofrece el servicio de costura, desde hace unos años, su negocio lo tiene en su casa, cuenta con su propia clientela y también realiza trabajos a pedidos, la competencia en el rubro no es mucha, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares diarias.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 600 para comprar material y así pueda seguir brindando un buen servicio y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le han hecho, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ganancias para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Flor con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar su negocio adelante y a brindarle otras oportunidades en la vida a su familia.
texts.en:
20-year-old Flor lives with her husband and children in her own home which has water and electricity.  It is located in Monsefú district, in Chiclayo province: an area which is noted for its agriculture, livestock raising and handicrafts.

Flor's business is embroidering sheets and tablecloths with a sewing machine.  She also provides sewing services.  She has been in this business for some years and it is located in her home.  She has her own customer base and also works to order.  There isn't much competition in her field and she uses the income she makes to cover the daily needs of her family.

Flor has requested a loan for 600 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa, through their seed capital fund, in order to buy material so that she can continue providing a good service and fulfilling the orders that people have placed with her.  This will enable her to make more profits so that she can improve her family's quality of life.  Through a lot of effort and hard work, Flor has known how to move her business ahead and provide her family with more opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy material so that she can continue embroidering

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel is 29 years old and married. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucel is borrowing 22,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and additional pigs. 

Lucel has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from electronic re-loading (cell phone minute sales). 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and additional pigs

loans.name: Cumbe Centro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe Centro está formado por 5 socias y un socio quienes laboran arduamente en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten ayudar y salir  adelante con sus familias. Nuestras socias viven por la parroquia de Cumbe, este  lugar  es de clima frió y nos regala un hermoso paisaje y vista de la naturaleza, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señorita Andrea, es socia del banco comunal Cumbe Centro, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su padre quien es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios con su propia unidad de taxi. Comparten los gastos del hogar y la casa en que habitan es propiedad de su padre.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal hace 6 años, vende sus productos todos los días y sin un horario fijo. También en su casa cría de gallinas. 

Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para incrementar su negocio.

Su meta es tener un local para vender sus cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Cumbe Centro Communal Bank is made up of five women and one man who work hard in different activities that allow them to help their families and get ahead with them.  Our members live near the parish of Cumbe.  This place has a cold climate with a pretty landscape and a view of nature.  The people there maintain the culture and traditions of their communities, and they work in commerce, raising animals, and agriculture.

Andrea is one of the members of this group.  She is a member of Cumbe Centro Communal Bank.  She is 28 years old and single, and lives with her father, who is a driver by profession and works for hire with his own taxi.  They share the household expenses, and the house they live in belongs to her father.
 
Andrea has been selling Yanbal cosmetics for six years.  She sells her products every day and without a set schedule.  She also raises chickens at home.

This is the fourth loan she has taken from the communal bank, and she will use her new loan to buy chickens to increase her business.

Her goal is to have a place to sell her cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Elsa has a shop where she makes & sells homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

Elsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia has operated a business of butchery in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last year. She is 42 years old, married to Samuel, and they have four school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her sixth loan. She paid all of her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more sheep and cattle.

In future, Teresia hopes to expand the business and become the best business woman in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy more sheep and cattle.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child who goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family member. She operates a food stall at the market. Her other source of income is from dry cleaning services. She has been in this business for the last five years.  She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy Irish potatoes, bananas, cassava, tomatoes and onions. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked stall and to buy a plot of land.  Her major business challenges are defaulters and the rainy season. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication and rent
