To make a living Mildred owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and spices to the local community. Mildred has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. Mildred joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mildred is requesting her first loan from GDMPC of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia es D. la ciudad D. Santani es macatera (vendedora ambulante), venD. calzados deportivos.
Ella tiene casa propia, y laboralmente una clientela bien formada ya que tiene buenos precios y calidad en sus productos, además del buen trato con los clientes.
Su proyecto es construir un depósito para sus mercaderías, para poder trabajar desD. un local propio, D. manera estable.
Como muchas personas compran D. ella los calzados, solicita el crédito para que pueda adquirir mayor cantidad para la reventa y D. esta manera obtener un mayor margen D. ganancia.
texts.en:
Antonia is from the city of Santaní and she owns her house. She sells athletic shoes as a traveling saleswoman. She works with a well-established clientele, as she has good quality products and prices, in addition to good customer service. Her plan is to build a storage area for her merchandise so that her business will be more stable and she can work from her own place.

Since many people buy shoes from her, she is requesting the loan so that she can obtain a larger quality to sell and have a higher profit margin.

loans.use: to buy athletic shoes to sell

loans.name: Veronica Esther

texts.es:
Verónica de 20 años, es una joven emprendedora que trabaja como cajera en un supermercado llamado El éxito. Ella aplicó para un crédito de monto bajo para mejorar su vivienda.

Ahora ella sigue trabajando en el supermercado de 7:00am a 21:30 pm  para poder mantener a su hijo de 2 años. Con el préstamo quiere implementos de construcción para poder terminar su vivienda y así tener una vida mejor para su hijo. Ella aspira en un futuro tener un mejor puesto en el lugar donde labora.
texts.en:
Verónica, 20 years old, is an enterprising young woman who works as a cashier in the El Éxito supermarket. She is applying for a small loan to improve her house.

She works in the supermarket from 7 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. in order to support her two-year-old son. She will use the loan to purchase building supplies so she can finish her house and provide a better life for her son. In the future, she'd like to receive a promotion in her current place of employ.

loans.use: to purchase building supplies

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, age 35, earns a living by selling bread. She and her husband, who works as a policeman, have seven children, all of whom are enrolled in school. 

Christine has requested a loan in order to stock more bread to offer for sale. She hopes eventually to build a house for the family with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to offer for sale

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroele electrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive el joven Evaristo A. el cual tiene la edad de 21 años, estudio hasta el sexto de preparatoria y es soltero. 
Evaristo nos platica que hace un par de años sali de la escuela y ha tenido la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, tambien nos dice que el tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual se vendia abarrotes pero por falta de recursos economicos tuvo que cerrarlo, el necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de Arroz, frijol, sal, azucar, jitomates, chiles, cebolla, huevos, papel higienico, atun, arinas, galletas, refrescos y dulces para resurtir su negocio y volverlo ha abrir.
el nos dice que con esta inversion volvera a abrir su negocio,  con el buen trato a las personas y teniendo surtido el negocio volvora a hacer mas clientes y poco a poco con sus ahorros y ganancias lo hara crecer ya que a futuro le gustaria agrandarlo y no solo vender abarrotes sino tambien visuteria.
Evaristo se encuentra muy agradecido con la fundacion y envia un saludo a las personas que hacen posibles estos creditos.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca, there is a community called San Miguel Soyaltepec.  This community has a very large lake which provides a lot of fish and work each year.  It is also well known because the Cerro de Oro hydroelectric dam is located there.  This community is where Evaristo A. lives.  He is a young man of 21 who is single and studied up to the sixth year of high school.  

Evaristo tells us that he left school a couple of years ago.  He needed to work in order to help his parents with their household expenses.  He also tells us that he has a small sales location in his home where he sells groceries but, owing to a lack of money, he had to close it.  He needs this loan to invest in buying rice, beans, salt, sugar, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, eggs, toilet paper, tuna, flour, cookies, soft drinks and sweet treats so that he can restock his business and open it again.

Evaristo tells us that, with this investment, he will re-open his business.  By providing good customer service and having his store well stocked, he will have more customers again and, gradually, with his savings and his profits, he will make his business grow.  In the future, he would like to expand his business and not only sell groceries but also costume jewelry.

Evaristo is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and he sends greetings to the people who make these loans possible.

loans.use: to buy groceries and jewelry

loans.name: Alexi

texts.es:
Alexi, es una persona muy trabajadora, vive con su familia y posee su propio negocio, en una mueblería y carpintería, inicio como empleado en otro taller y actualmente tiene la necesidad de comprar dos maquinas vitales para realizar sus trabajos.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas: dos cepilladoras electricas, una manual y otra de mesa, pues no cuenta con el monto suficiente para cubrir el gasto, por lo que este préstamo le ayudara muchísimo para realizar de una mejor manera los procesos de los muebles y ampliar la variedad de estilos.
Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio con la obtención de nuevas maquinas, de esta manera estar realizando un mejor trabajo que le genere más ganancias.
texts.en:
Alexi is a very hard-working person who lives with his family and owns his own business (a furniture store and carpentry workshop).  He started out as an employee in another workshop and currently needs to buy two machines which are essential for his workshop.

Alexi is requesting a loan to buy two tools: a manual electric planer and a bench-mounted electric planer, as he does not have enough money to cover this expense.  The loan will help him a lot as he will improve his furniture and increase the range of styles he offers.

Alexi's goal is to strengthen his business by obtaining new machines.  In this way, he will produce better work which will make him more profits.

loans.use: to buy a manual electric planer and a bench-mounted electric planer.

loans.name: Armando Alberto Pedro

texts.es:
El Señor Armando tiene 46 años de edad vive en la urbanización “San Juan de Dios” en la zona oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba, con sus dos hijos que aun dependen económicamente de su trabajo y su madre que también vive con ellos en una casa en alquiler.
Armando trabaja como auxiliar de contabilidad en una empresa de limpieza y como segunda actividad tiene un radiotaxi donde realiza su trabajo en horario de la noche, ya que tiene que pagar los medicamentos de la madre y su hijo que tuvo un accidente que lo dejo sin movimiento en las piernas y tiene que realizar fisioterapias que son muy caras es por esa razón que el Señor Armando tiene que hacer un doble esfuerzo ya que la madre de sus hijos los abandono cuando ellos eran niños y desde ese momento solo él se hizo cargo de la educación el cuidado y el futuro de sus hijos y de su madre.
El solicita el crédito para compra de un tanque de gas para su vehículo ya que con eso tendrá más ingresos y sus costos en combustible bajaran consideradamente y podrá realizar más servicios en el transporte de pasajeros, Armando es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora el sueña que su hijo vuelva a caminar y que los dos terminen una carrera ya que el no pudo hacerlo, trata de brindarles un futuro mejor para cada uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Armando is 46 years old and lives in "San Juan de Dios” development, in the western part of the city of Cochabamba.  He lives in a rental house together with his two children who are still financially dependent on him, and his mother.

Armando works as an accounting assistant in a cleaning company.  His second business activity is running a radio taxi.  He does this work at night since he needs to pay for his mother's medicines and also those of his son who had an accident which left him with no movement in his legs.  He has to undergo physiotherapy sessions which are very expensive.  Armando has to make twice as much effort since the mother of his children abandoned them when they were very young and, from that moment on, he became solely responsible for the education, care and future of his children, in addition to taking care of his mother.

Armando is requesting this loan to buy a natural gas tank for his vehicle since this will enable him to make more income and his fuel costs will drop considerably.  This means he will be able to transport more passengers.  Armando is a very responsible and hard-working person.  He dreams that his son will be able to walk again and that both of his children will finish degree courses since that is something he could not do.  He is trying to provide both of his children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy a natural gas tank for his vehicle

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 53 years old and married with seven children. Claudia works very hard to provide for them. 

Claudia runs a Sari-sari (variety) Store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as bread, drinks, detergent, and other groceries. 

In the future Claudia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has 2 children. She is 51 years old and lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Elizabeth sells different kind of products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and anything that is needed in a household.  She has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 9000 from this work. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 30000 to purchase more products such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap for her general store. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: buy products for her general store

loans.name: Norwin Antonio

texts.es:
Norwin de 36 años de edad es soltero, tiene un niño de 5 años de edad, labora como fontanero en ENACAL desde hace 2 años, ademas hace trabajos extras de fontaneria a personas que le buscan despues de su jornada laboral.

Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa,  embaldosando su cuarto, ya que con el invierno las lluvias se humedece el cuarto y no quiere que su pequeño hijo se enferme. 

Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia las condiciones basicas del hogar y que su hijo crezca y sea una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Norwin is 36 years old, single and has a 5 year-old son.  He has been working as a plumber for ENACAL for two years.  He also does extra, private plumbing work for people who request it after he finishes his workday.

Norwin is requesting his second loan to improve his house by tiling a room since, in the winter, the rain makes the room damp and he doesn't want his young son to become sick.

Norwin's biggest dreams are to be able to provide his family with the basic conditions they need in their home and for his son to grow up and become an honest and upstanding citizen.

loans.use: to tile a room

loans.name: Gennadiy

texts.ru:
Геннадий живет и работает в Мелитополе. Он торгует сладкой ватой, конфетами, разными кондитерскими изделиями, минеральной водой, напитками и прочим в центральном городском парке своего города. В его маленьком киоске всегда можно увидеть широкий ассортимент товара и постоянных покупателей. Геннадий отличается предприимчивостью и умением правильно вести свой бизнес. Он занимается этой мелкой торговлей уже 16 лет. Его доход составляет 8.500 гривен. 

Сумму в 20.000 гривен Геннадий хотел бы вложить в закупку дополнительного ассортимента продуктовых товаров, а именно конфет, печенья, сока и мороженного. За счет увеличения ассортимента товара Геннадий планирует получить дополнительную прибыль и приобрести холодильную камеру. Одной из целей Геннадия является расширить свой бизнес и, по возможности, открыть еще одну точку. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Gennadiy lives and works in Melitopol.  He sells cotton candy, candy, various confectionery goods, mineral water, drinks and other products at the city central park in his own town.  One can always see a wide assortment of products and loyal customers in his small food store.  Gennadiy stands out through his entrepreneurship and ability to steer his business well.  He has been involved in such retail sales for sixteen years.  His income amounts to 8,500 hryvnia.  Gennadiy wants to invest a sum of 20,000 hryvnia into the purchase of additional products, especially, candy, cookies, juice and ice-cream.  Due to the increased variety of product, Gennadiy plans to receive additional profits and buy a refrigerator.  One of Gennadiy's goals is to expand his business and possibly open another retail outlet.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of food products and a refrigerator

loans.name: Vanessa Marisol

texts.es:
Vanesa, se dedica a la venta de comida y meriendas, vive con su madre y un hijo de 5 años, este negocio lo inicio hace dos años, por iniciativa propia, con el deseo de superarse y ayudar a su hijo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollo, carne, pastas, arroz, yuca y plátanos, estos materiales los necesita para la elaboración de comida y las meriendas, con el préstamo podrá contar con todo lo necesario para su negocio.
El objetivo de ella es crecer en sus ventas, garantizar a su hijo un futuro mejor y ahorrando para cubrir cualquier necesidad.
texts.en:
Vanesa sells food and lunches.  She lives with her mother and her 5-year-old son.  She started the business two years ago though her own initiative because she wanted to improve herself and help her son.

At present, she’s asking for a loan to buy chicken, meat, pasta, rice, manioc and bananas.  She needs these supplies to prepare her meals and food.  With the loan she’ll be able to have everything she needs for her business on hand.

Her goal is to have her sales increase to guarantee a better future for her son and to save up to cover any need that might arise.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, pasta, rice, manioc and bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pop drinks, luncheon meat and powdered milk

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: Mirtha es socia del Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun, tiene 34 años y 6 hijos, vende golosinas en el Parque Sucre, ahora invertirá para irse a Lima y comprar ropa porque quiere cambiar de negocio, ella es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 6 años, inició su negocio vendiendo también golosina en Huanta, a raíz de las fuertes lluvias  perdió todo lo que tenía, una de sus amigas la invitó a FINCA Peru y así empezó a ser socia, agradece por los préstamos obtenidos porque eso le ayudó en la educación de sus hijos, ahora tiene una casa pequeña y su sueño es comprar un terreno, lo que mas le gusta de las reuniones de su Banco Comunal es que le enseñaron a poder ser bien responsable, le enseñaron a ahorrar. Otra de sus metas es tener una Bodega.
texts.en: Mirtha is a member of the community bank Yanapanakusun, she is 34 and has six children.  She sells sweets in the Sucre park, she will invest the loan in traveling to Lima to buy clothing because she wants to start a new business, she has been a member of FINCA Peru for six years, she started the business selling sweets in Huanta, due to horrible storms she lost everything she had, one of her friends invited her to join FINCA Peru and that is how she became a member, she is grateful for the loans she has received because that helped her with the education of her children, she now has a small house and her dream is to buy a lot, what she likes the most from the meetings with the community bank is that they taught her to be responsible and to save.  Another one of her goals is to have a warehouse.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
This is Daisy, 43, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jacinto, a warehouse man, and mother to their five children.  Two are now studying in college. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Daisy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from this, she also sells cooked viands and she earns additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Daisy hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 42 años, es una mujer alegre y dinámica, es madre soltera de tres hijos, pero solo vive con su último hijo de 8 años, por quien cuida de su educación. Ambos habitan en su casa propia. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de comida, actividad que inicia desde muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar los ingredientes y especias que necesitará al momento de preparar sus alimentos. Su buena sazón han atraido a muchos clientes, es así que las afueras de su casa, lugar donde expende su comida, esta repleta de fieles consumidores. Tiene tres años trabajando en esta actividad y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es wur está siempre activa y en contacto con las personas, ya que le gusta mucho conversar e intercambiar opiniones con sus clientes, por ello desea tener un local apropiado para que pueda seguir vendiendo y ofreciendo mejor comodidad a sus clientes. Este será el sexto crédito con MFP, y por tanto pide que lo apoyen para continuar trabajando. Con el monto solicitado, podrá comprar materiales para acondicionar un local pequeño para atender a sus clientes. Además comprará ingredientes e insumos para la preparación de comida.
texts.en:
Patricia, 42, is a cheerful, dynamic woman.  She’s a single mother of three children but only her youngest, 8-year-old, son still lives with her; she sees to his education.  They live together in her own house.  

Her work consists in selling food, an activity she starts very early when she goes to the market to buy the ingredients and spices she needs at the moment of preparing her meals.  Her tasty preparations have attracted many customers so the space outside her house where she serves her meals is always crowded with faithful customers.  

She’s been in this business for three years and has worked alone to date.  What she likes about her work is being always active and in contact with people because she enjoys chatting and exchanging opinions with them very much.  Because of this, she’d like to have a properly furnished space where she can continue selling and offering more comfort to her customers.

This will be her sixth MFP loan so she’s asking for your support so she can stay in business.  She will use the amount requested to buy materials to equip a small locale to take care of customers in.  In addition, she’ll buy ingredients and supplies to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare meals as well as materials to equip the space.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, 39 years old, is married and has four school-aged children. The family lives in the village where Vilma generates an income through her crop production. Her business serves as a source of income for the family and helps provide for their daily needs.

Vilma is an industrious and cheerful person, which is why she also started up a retail store for additional income. She says it is not easy work to take on this occupation but since she is determined to provide for her children, she does everything to lift her family from poverty.

Vilma is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her crop production and additional grocery stock for her general store. She hopes that she can get the amount she requests to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farming and additional grocery stock for her general store

loans.name: Lunke

texts.en: Lunke is 38 years old and has for the last 10 years earned a living as a farmer in the town of Ndunyu Njeru. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and is applying for his second loan. He repaid his first loan fully and on time, and plans to use this new one to buy more sheep to raise. His goal for the future is to increase his income by buying land to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy more sheep to raise.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
A sus 18 años de edad Jessica es una joven emprendedora que decidió montar su propio negocio a raíz de una capacitación que recibió en creación de empresa, lleva aproximadamente 2 meses en esta labor que desempeña con gran tenacidad para salir adelante, Jessica vende comida rápida a las afueras de su casa, y aunque a veces los horarios son difíciles ve un buen panorama en ventas y posicionamiento.

Actualmente Jessica quiere comprar sillas y mesas para ambientar el espacio de una forma mas cómoda e igualmente comprar insumos para la preparación de la comida, sin embargo no cuenta con el capital necesario para hacer dichas compras, por lo que solicita un crédito que le permita darle mas fuerza a su negocio para que las ventas se incrementen, generando mas ingresos y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At 18 years of age, Jessica is a young entrepreneur who decided to set up her own business as a result of training she received in business creation. She has been working for approximately 2 months at this with great tenacity to get ahead. Jessica sells fast food outside her house and although at times the schedule is difficult she sees a good future ahead for sales and positioning. 

Currently Jessica wants to buy tables and chairs to create a more comfortable ambience in the space as well as buy consumables with which to make the food. However, she does not have the capital necessary to make the purchases which is why she is asking for a loan that will allow her to strengthen her business so that sales increase, generating more income and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and consumables to improve her business.

loans.name: Mwene

texts.en: Mwene is 28 years old, married, has three children and lives in the town of Bundibugyo, Uganda, where she has earned a living for the last six years by running a retail shop. Her main challenges are a shortage of capital, high transportation costs, variable prices and customers who fail to pay their bills on time. Her main goals in life are to earn enough money to educate her children and to expand her business while also moving it to a more permanent location. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, including sugar, soap, salt and sodas.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Success Group

texts.en:
Saikos is a 33-year-old man and is married with 2 children, aged 6 and 1 year. Only one child goes to school. His wife is also a student, enrolled at Great Zimbabwe University. 

He sells clothes, shoes and other things from a stand at the Garikai Flea Market in the town center. He has been in the business for 2 years. He buys his products from Harare as well as locally. He has no employees. There is high competition in the market, being the challenge he faces in the business. 

In the next 5 years he would like to open a grocery shop as well as a boutique. The loan will improve his family's life, as he will be able to pay for his wife to complete her education as well as save for their children's future.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and sugar beans.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 45 years old and married. He has three grown up children. Ronald has been engaged in the farming business for ten years. Farming is his main source of their income. He is a very loving father and husband. He will do everything to see to the needs of his family.

Ronald is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy fertilizer for his farm. He hopes that his business will expand to see the need of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm business.

loans.name: Mpofu1 Group

texts.en:
Femberwi is a 33 year old woman who is married and has four children aged 12, 10, 6 and 4. Three of the children attend school and Femberwi does not have any other dependent whom she stays with. Her husband is working in Botswana.

She is into buying and selling of electrical goods such as television, decoder dishes and home theaters. She has been in the business for two years and has one employee who works for her. She operates from home and buys her products from South Africa. The major business challenge is that some of her debtors fail to make payments. With the extra income from this loan, she will be able to provide for her family's needs and supplement her husband's salary and not strain the business.

She is planning to operate an electrical wholesale shop in Masvingo central Business District and employ a handful of people to help reduce unemployment level in her country.

loans.use: to buy television sets, home theaters, decoder dishes and blankets for resale

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a meat vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional meat to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for 5 years. Marivic earns additional income by raising pigs.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional meat to sell

loans.name: Sipiu

texts.en:
Sipiu is twenty one years of age and is married with two children. Sipiu owns and operates a business venture selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has three years of experience in this business. Sipiu needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Sipiu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Sipiu's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional daily use products to sell.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a 28-year-old married woman with two young children ages 6 and 4. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Mirasol has been a farmer for five years and she grows vegetables to sell at her town's market. She does her best to improve her business and take care of her children. 

Mirasol is requesting a loan to purchase more seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to improve her crop yield and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Worokhiya's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé en décembre 2009.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même village.Elles ont pour activité principale le maraîchage.

Celle qui léve la main sur la photo,est la responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 53 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 05 enfants.

Son activité consiste à s'occuper d'un périmétre de jardin pour cultiver des légumes et de la salade.

Elle compte acheter de l'engrais et des semences avec son prêt.

Son objectif est de contribuer aux charges liées à la scolarité des enfants et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in December 2009. It is composed of members who are from the same village and who engage primarily in market gardening. 

The one whose hand is raised in the photo is the leader of the group. She is 53 years old and is married and a mother of five children. 

She manages a perimeter of a garden and cultivates vegetables and lettuce. She hopes to buy fertilizer and seeds with her loan. 

Her goal is to contribute to the expenses related to her children's schooling and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Conception

texts.en: CONCEPTION, 49 YEAR OLD, MARRIED AND HAS 3 CHILDREN. SHE BORROWED A LOAN TO BUY FOR MORE GOODS IN HER COLA DRINKS RETAIL BUSINESS. WITH THIS BUSINESS SHE WAS ABLE TO PROVIDE THEIR NEEDS AND ABLE TO HELP HER HUSBAND WHO IS A PRIVATE DRIVER. SHE WAS ABLE TO GIVE HER CHILDREN SOME OF THEIR DIRECT NEEDS. SHE ALSO SELL A COLD AND ICE WATER THAT HELP HER PAY THEIR BILLS. SHE WANT TO EXPAND HER BUSINESS AND SOON OPEN HER OWN SARI-SARI STORE THAT WILL HELP HER A LOT.

loans.use: TO BUY FOR MORE GOODS IN HER RETAIL BUSINESS

location.town: RAW-AN POINT, BAROY, LANAO DEL NORTE

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region Minkend village. He is married. He settled with family in Sumgait city. This 41-year-old man, Rasim started his business 5 years ago. His first loan was $500, bought 6 sheep. 
Rasim applies for a loan amount of 1000$ to buy 6 sheeps and 2 calves.

loans.use: To buy 6 sheeps and 2 calves

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Orn O. and her husband run a small business in the city of Phnom Penh. Together, they plant crops which they use to help support themselves and their three children. Additionally, O. and her husband raise pigs which they will soon sell to a butcher at the local market. As another source of income, O. sews clothes for friends and neighbors in her village.

As O. and her husband make just enough money to break even, they often rely on their daughter--who works at a nearby factory--for support. O. plans to use this loan to help feed their pigs and also to repair their house.

loans.use: To raise pigs and to repair house

loans.name: Monica Ngondap

texts.en:
Monica was born into a polygamous home. Because of their number and the limited resources she was not fortunate to be educated. Her lack of education and hardship is her motivation to make the world a better place for her six surviving children. Her determination, training in marketing techniques, credit management, and experience in the utilization and repayment of previous loans, and support from group and center members are strengths she will continue to build on.

With a loan of $400, Monica plans to buy seeds, rent farm-land and cultivate food crops. From this investment she will provide her community with vegetables and raw solid foodstuffs. She plans on paying her monthly installments with sales from the vegetables. She plans to repay the  loan during the term.

loans.use: Buying of seeds and foodstuffs

loans.name: Ivapene

texts.en: Ivapene is a 42 year old mother of two children. Her eldest daughter is now employed at a Factory Company in town (Apia) while her younger one is still in school hoping to graduate next year. Her husband is an unemployed fisherman like her, but working together with Ivapene in their plantation, and goes fishing when there is a demand for fish. In the mean time, Ivapene’s family are staying in an open house with palm leaves roofing and no flooring. Ivapene explains that with her previous loans, she tried to maintain her taro plantation in a stable condition, and concentrating on her children’s schooling needs. Now her kids are grown up, one is already successful with a job, and another one still finishing schooling. Her aim with her requested loan is to build a new galvanized iron roofing with lumber walls, and also to purchase chemicals needed for her business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals for plantation, and mainly for purchasing materials for home improvement.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu is married, thirty-three years old, and has four children. Her husband is a teacher whose income is inadequate to meet the family's expenses, so Isatu used her previous loan to start a business selling beans, sugar and other essentials. This income is mostly used to meet school fees and feeding expenses for her family.  Isatu is requesting a loan of  $250 to increase her stock and enable her to earn more income.

loans.use: To increase her stock at her market stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sodas, juices and food.

loans.name: Granadilla 5 Group

texts.es:
Yazmin is 21-years-old and has one son. Her husband works in the offices of Petroleos mexicanos (PEMEX). She makes crafts out of flexible rubber and felt for decorating the home, keepsakes, holidays, and birthdays. She sells them among her neighbors, family members, and friends. Two of the other members of the group make crafts like bracelets and belts out of silk thread. Erendida orders shoes from catalogs and sells them women in their community.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

YAZMIN TIENE 21 AÑOS , UN HIJO SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO EMPLEADO PARTICULAR EN LAS OFICNAS DE PETROLEOS MEXICANOS ( PEMEX ), ELLA SE DEDICA REALIZANDO Y CONFECCIONANDO MANUALIDADES EN MATERIALES DE GOMA FLEXIBLE Y GENERO ( FIELTRO) PARA DECORACION DEL HOGAR , RECUERDOS , FIESTAS Y CUMPLEAÑOS . LAS VENDE ENTRE SUS VECINAS, FAMILIARES Y AMIGOS . LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SE DESEMPEÑAN DOS DE ELLAS REALIZANDO ARTESANIAS TALES COMO PULSERAS Y CINTURONES EN HILOS DE SEDA EN CAMBIO ERENDIDA SE DEDICA A VENDER ZAPATOS A PEDIDOS POR CATALOGO ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SUS COMUNIDAD .

loans.use: They will invest in purchasing matierials to supply their businesses and to increase the production of their crafts

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty is dedicated to making beautiful embroideries for typical dresses, which she makes day to day with a lot of patience and enjoyment. She likes what she does and fondly recalls how she started at the suggestion of one of her friends. She started embroidering traditional items called "plumilladas" and selling them at festivals and markets in her area. Years have passed and today she has become one of the best embroiderers in her area. Now she only takes orders from her demanding customers, who come to her in every season for fine handmaD. work. This art form she has mastered due to her excellent color combinations and a high-quality finished product. With the passage of time she has seen with satisfaction all she has accomplished. She has never neglected her children and like any good mother has provided for them equally along with her husband, who currently is in a delicate condition and awaiting an operation. Because of this, Betty has worked even harder, with the help of her daughters. To be help her beloved husband's recovery she is requesting a loan to purchase a larger quantity of materials (fabric, thread, etc.) for her business. Support Betty in this time of need for our solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Betty, se dedica a realizar bellos bordados para los trajes típicos que produce día a día con mucha paciencia y gusto por que disfruta lo que hace, y recuerda muy bien como se inició por invitación D. una D. sus amigas y comenzó bordando fustanes D. tela a la que llaman plumillada en las ferias y mercados D. su zona, Han pasado los años y hoy se ha convertido en una D. las mejores bordadoras D. su localidad, ahora sólo cubre pedidos D. sus exigentes clientes que en cada temporada solicitan sus trabajos manuales muy bien elaborados, ese arte que domina acompañada D. la excelente combinación D. colores aseguran un acabado y un trabajo D. calidad. Con el paso D. los años observa con satisfacción todo lo que ha logrado durante estos años. Jamás descuido a sus hijos y como buena madre cubrió sus necesidades al igual que su esposo que en la actualidad se encuentra delicado D. salud y esta pronto a ser operado. Por este último motivo, Betty, trabaja aún con más esfuerzo y con la ayuda D. sus hijas. Para otorgarle una recuperación adecuada a su querido esposo solicita el préstamo D. una suma D. dinero a fin D. adquirir mayor cantidad D. materia prima. Apoya en estos momentos a Betty que necesita D. nuestra solidaridad.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Buzika East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Naume M.. She is currently in the business of operating a hardware shop and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Naume is 34 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 6 children ranging from age 3 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Naume makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a commercial motorcycle. Naume has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to her hardware business and the loan was paid back on time.

Naume is joined in her small group by Nuuru N., Margret S., Hadijah K., and Teklah Nabuuso. Nuuru N. has a business in brick laying and wants to boost business. Margret S. is currently operating a business in bakery and wants a loan to expand the business. Hadijah K. operates a grocery store business and wants to increase stock. Teklah Nabuuso is currently in the business of running a stationary shop and is requesting a loan to add more capital.

loans.use: To purchase more hardware equipment to sell

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana Maria M. A. is native to the city of Bluefields. She is 38 years old, is married to Mr. Gerardo Castro, and they have four children.  For the last seven years, Mrs. M. has been the owner of a small general store whose customers are the other residents of the neighborhood. They prefer her because she offers a variety of products. 
At this time, Mrs. M. needs to buy a 2 units of rice at $45 each, 1 unit of sugar at $37 each, 1 drum of oil at $41 each, 1 unit of flour at $48 each, 1 unit of salt at $7 each, 3 boxes of sauces at $9 per box, 3 cases of soap at $16 each, 3 dozen units of spaghetti at $12 per unit, 7 cases of cookies at $8 each, 2 sacks of detergent at $9 each, 1 package of bleach at $10 each, 2 packages of toilet paper at $12 each, 1 box of sanitary napkins at $10 each, 1 packets of disposable diapers at $6 each, 1 dozen tubes of toothpaste at $10 per dozen, and 50 pounds of chicken at $1 per pound. 
With this investment she will be able to satisfy the demands of her customers. 
Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer. 

La Sra. Juana Maria M. A. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Gerardo Castro ambos tiene 4 hijos. La Sra. M. desde hace 7 años es propietaria de una pulpería teniendo como cliente a los habitantes de su barrio que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos en estos momentos la Sra. M. necesita comprar 2 quintales de arroz a $ 45.00 dólares el quintal, 1 quintal de azúcar a $37.00 dólares el quintal, 1 bidón de aceite a $ 41.00 dólar el bidón, 1 quintal de harina a $48.00 dólares el quintal, 1 quintal de sal a $7.00 dólares el quintal ,3 cajas de salsa a $ 9.00 dólares la caja,3 cajas de jabón a $16.00 dólares la caja  ,3 cajas de sopas a $11.00 dólares la caja, 3 docenas de espagueti a $ 12.00 dólares la docena,7 cajas de galletas a $ 8.00 dólares la caja,2 bolsones de detergente a $9.00 dólares el bolsón, 1 bolsa de cloro a $10.00 dólares la bolsa, 2 bolsones de papel higiénico a $ 12.00 dólares el bolsón, 1 caja de toalla sanitaria a $ 10.00 dólares la caja, 2 paquetes de pañales desechables a $6.00 dólares el paquete, 1 docena de pasta dental a $10.00 dólares la docena y 50 libras de pollo a $ 1.00 dólar la libra con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase a wide variety of goods for her small grocery/general store to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Mwantumu's Uwenacho Group

texts.en:
Mwantumu is 38 years old and is married with 5 children, ages 5 to 25. Mwantumu is a utensils seller; she started her business in 1992. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more utensils for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Mwandaima, who has a business dealing in fish sales.

loans.use: To buy more utensils for her business

loans.name: Deborah Nanteza's Group

texts.en:
Deborah is a leader of 5 members. She is 46 years old and is divorced with 7 children, who are 30, 28, 22, 18, 16, 14 and 12 years old. The youngest four go to school. Her community is semi-urban. She has been operating a pub in the area for 14 years. Her challenges include stiff competition, getting payment for what she sells on credit and sometimes losing it, and high transport costs especially when she goes to the rural areas to collect local brew.

She says that the loans have helped to sustain her business for the 14 years, and enabled her to fend for the family. Her biggest dream is to educate all of her children to a high level. Another plan is to acquire a plot of land in order to build a house. She has successfully paid back more than 10 loans.

loans.use: To invest more in her children's education.

loans.name: Laura Patricia

texts.es:
Laura is married and the mother of 3 children: 12-year old Laurita and 3-year old twins, Pedro and Pablo. She started her business three years ago after the the twins were born. They were born premature and needed several expensive operations and other care. Her husband was out of work and she needed to start a business at home so that she could both care for the kids and help with the family's expenses. She now makes and sells flour torillas. She started by selling the tortillas to neighbors and, over time, her business has grown and her sales have increased.

Laura is applying for a US$500 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, that she will use to remodel the business (expand it) so that she can offer better service to her customers. With your help, Laura will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Laura es casada y madre D. 3 hijos Laurita D. 12 años, y unos gemelos Pedro y Pablo D. 3 años. Inició el negocio hace tres años, cuando nacieron sus gemelos, los cuales nacieron prematuros, y requirieron varias operaciones, y tratamientos muy caros, su esposo se encontraba desempleado, y se vio en la necesidad D. emprender un negocio en su casa para ayudar al gasto familiar, y poder cuidar a sus hijos .menores. Ella necesitaba dinero para operar a sus gemelitos, y requería D. una entrada D. dinero para poder salir adelante con el gasto familiar. Comenzó su negocio hace tres años, ya que su esposo estaba desempleado y no contaban con ningún recurso, fue entonces que empezó a hacer tortillas D. harina y las vendía a sus vecinos, con el paso del tiempo, su negocio creció y sus ventas aumentaron.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses el cual le servirá para remodelar el negocio (Ampliarlo), así podar ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Laura saldra adelante.

loans.use: Expand business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Ice lollies, snow cones, jell-o and chilled sodas - this is what María sells on a daily basis and she has positioned herself in an appropriate location for the sale of her products. She feels happy to be in this location as lots of people come to buy her snow cones and ice lollies. At 25 years of age, she is a mother of two sons who are at school. Her partner, Julián works with wood and is very supportive of her as he was the one who encouraged her to start in this business.

For María, it is important that her business keeps growing. She wants to build a kiosk for the sale of her frozen products so that she can have more space and in this way be more attentive towards her customers. For this reason, she requests a loan and appeals for your help. She will be eternally grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Chupetes, marcianos, gelatinas y gaseosas heladas es lo que vende diariamente la señora María, quien se encuentra ubicada en un lugar apropiado para venta de sus productos, ella se siente feliz de estar en ese lugar ya que concurre mucha gente a comprar sus marcianos y chupetes. A sus 25 años es madre de 2 hijos quienes están estudiando, su pareja, Julián se dedica a trabajar con madera, y la apoya en todo, ya que él fue quién la incentivo a ingresar en este negocio.Para la señora María es importante seguir creciendo, por ello desea construir un kiosco para la venta de sus productos helados y así tener mayor espacio y una mejor atención hacia los clientes. Por esta razón es que solicita el préstamo solicitado y de acudir en su ayuda, estará agradecida de por vida.

loans.use: To build a kiosk for the sale of her ice lollies

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is divorced and has one child. Larisa is the only breadwinner in the family. She used some of her savings to start small business selling clothing and footwear. She rented a facility which is located in her home town of Ordzhonikidze. Larisa's politeness and rich experience help her operate the business effectively. She's been in this business for only about a year. However, it was long enough to get to know her customers' preferences and tastes, which makes her little store popular among customers and helps her be a successful entrepreneur. 

However, faced with the growing demand of her customers and insufficient financial means Larisa is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to meet her clients needs and to generate more profits. The loan will allow her purchase clothing and footwear products wholesale and to increase yher selling capacity. Successful trade will increase Larisa's income and help her get the amount she needs to provide her family with a decent living.  

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Aïchetou

texts.fr: Aïchetou A. est âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Revendeuse des légumes et d’épices, elle habite à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé la capitale togolaise. Aïchetou désire, par ce crédit, s’approvisionner en diverses légumes afin de répondre aux besoins pressants de la clientèle
texts.en:
Aïchetou A., 41, is married and the mother of 4 children. She sells vegetables and spices and lives in Kpalimé, a town situated about 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Aïchetou wants to use this loan to stock up on various vegetables so as to meet the pressing needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables and spices for resale

loans.name: Félix

texts.fr: Félix E. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de deux enfants. Il exerce depuis plus de 3 ans la mécanique à 2 roues à Lomé la capitale togolaise.  Avec ce crédit, son deuxième de FECECAV, il souhaite contribuer à la prospérité de son affaire. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour changer les conditions de sa vie.
texts.en:
Felix E. is 39 years old, married and the father of two (2) children. For over (3) years he has been a motorcycle mechanic in Lomé, the Togolese capital. He plans to use the loan, his second from FECECAV, to contribute to the value of his business. He expects this opportunity will change his living conditions.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tool boxes and reorganize his workshop.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana, 53 years old and married with three children, is a business-oriented woman even though she has no formal education and barely understands the English language.  She has operated a frozen foods business for many years, travelling to the Republic of Benin twice a week to purchase turkey and chicken. Christiana has 3 deep freezers in her shop, and she now hopes for a loan to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Someurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Someurn T., of Kompong Tom Province, is a 40-year old mother of four children, three employed and one attending school, who makes a living selling grocery items such as sugar, seasonings, onions, and cakes for kids from her home. She can earn approximately $4 per day while her 38-year-old husband, Mr. Chorn Sang, works outside the home.

Someurn is now requesting a loan of $625 to purchase more groceries to sell and to build a small store for making sales easier. Someurn's husband is pictured because she was not available for the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Un Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of 16 people is located in Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province and Mrs. Mom U. is village bank president. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household. She is 37 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Phal Trai, is a well digger in the local village. In his business, he now faces a problem because he has insufficient equipment to dig the wells. So Mrs. Mom U. decided to ask for a loan to buy equipment for her husband's business.

This is a village bank loan consisting of some end-of-term (EoT) loans. Four members have EoT loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those receiving EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy well-digging equipment.

loans.name: Lucila Berta

texts.es:
Lucila Berta Salmerón C. tiene la edad de 48 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Lucila tiene 1 hijo menor de la edad de 17 años actualmente cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos son superar con su negocio ya que la mayoría de sus clientes necesitan calidad en la elaboración de sus trajes y uniformes ya que hay muchas costureras que brindan el servicio y no se preocupan por complacer al cliente en lo que piden Doña Lucila tiene los sueños de que su hija administre su negocio y adquiera  los conocimientos adecuados para la superación propia y de su familia ya que este le ayudara como otro medio de ingresos para su futuro sus deseos son que su hija logre coronar una carrera profesional par que su dependencia de vida no solo este ligada con el negocio de la costura si no que  además de poseer este medio de trabajo obtenga una carrera que pueda desempeñar Doña Lucila se siente orgullosa de su hija ya que ella le ayuda en lo mas necesario.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la costura y la venta de ropa, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación en el Rpto San Carlos 2 calle, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es 6 años, Doña Lucila inicia este negocio por la necesidad de poseer otra fuente de ingresos ya que labora como docente en el colegio La Asunción ya que esta vendría a sustentar las necesidades de su hogar y de su familia por lo que decidió proponer  en su colegio la idea de que ella misma elaborara los uniformes y estos serian por encargos y fue así que obtuvo la oportunidad  de que el colegio donde Doña Lucila labora le facilitara su medio de trabajo por lo que esto le ayudo en la producción de sus uniformes por lo que poco a poco es que ha logrado aumentar y también por los financiamientos que ha hecho por medio de la Fundación León 2000 por lo que en al actualidad el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que lo primero es la compra de materia prima como lo es: hilo,zipper, aguja, tela, tijeras y los utensilios necesarios para la elaboración de los uniformes que ya están en reservados para la entrada a clases de este colegio.
texts.en:
Lucila Berta Salmerón C. is 48 years old, is married, and has one child who is 17 years old. He is currently in his 4th year of high school. Her dream is to improve the quality of the clothing she makes. There are many seamstresses who offer services but don't care about making the customer happy. Lucila hopes her child takes over the business and that she gains the necessary knowledge to be able to run the business. She hopes she becomes successful in life and this would be the perfect career that would make her mother proud. Lucida does clothing repair and sells clothes. She currently runs her business from her home, located in Rpto San Carlos 2 Calle. She's had her business for 6 years. She began this business going because of the economic need she had at the moment. At the time she suggested making the uniforms for her child's school. (La Asuncion), the school loved the idea and gave her the task of creating these. She was able to increase her earning a bit at a time. She's been getting her finance thru Fundación Leon 2000. At this time she hopes to get a loan in order to purchase: thread, zippers, needles,fabric, scissors, and other things needed to make the uniforms. Some customers have already placed their uniform orders for school year about to come.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: materials for making school uniforms

loans.name: Néhémie Group

texts.en:
Deborah is a 42-year-old woman with five children. All of her children are 12 years old or younger, and three of them are currently attending school.

With starting capital of just $200, Deborah began her business in 2002 by selling soft drinks. Today, she operates a general boutique, selling her goods in the northeastern area of Kinshasa. She explains that her business prospered from 2002 through 2004, but that the business went bankrupt in 2005 due to theft. Nevertheless, in 2007, Deborah re-launched her business with five crates of soft drinks and purified water. By generating profits of approximately $5 per day, she increased her working capital to $100.

Currently, Deborah is happy to be a part of one of Hope’s groups. Indeed, she joined the group in October 2008, and she notes that her business has been reinforced and has improved through the loan she received. Her dream is to open a soft drink store. For the time being, she is seeking this loan in order to expand her inventory: she would like to purchase five additional crates of soft drinks.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing five crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Ietidal

texts.en:
Ietidal is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Ietidal has owned a grocery store since 1997. She requested a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is his third loan, and she has repaid the other loans on time. 

Her previous loans helped her improve her store as well as improve her income. Her clients are her friends, neighbors, and others. She decided on doing this business because she always wanted to work and supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her store by diversifying her merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
El Sr. Fidel M., tiene 28 años de edad y vive en el barrio Virgen del Carmen de la  ciudad de Carapeguà. Tiene un hijo y no està casado.

Es empleado de una estaciòn de servicios llamada  Caranda, desempeñandose como playero tiene una antigüedad de 5 años. Tambien hace tres años que se dedica la venta ambulante por la zona de la  ciudad de Paraguarì y sus diferentes barrios. 

               Fidel es  muy conocido en la  zona por ser  muy  luchador  y responsable. Desde muy  niño se inicio trabajando como vendedor ambulante fuera de su casa, ya que su madre lo tuvo de muy  joven y  tuvo que dejarlos para viaja a al Argentina en  busca de mejores oportunidades, quedandosè el  al cuidado de su abuela y sus tres hermanos.
              
              Manifiesta estar muy contento con el trabajo que realiza ya que  gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio està logrando muchos proyectos.
          
                         Solicitò un prèstamo con nuestra entidad para la compra de zapatos  y  uniforme.
texts.en:
Fidel M. is 28 years old, and lives in the Virgen del Carmen neighborhood in the city of Carapeguà. He has one son and is not married. Fidel works in a gas station called Caranda, and has been an attendant there for five years. Three years ago, Fidel also became a street vendor in the Paraguarì area of the city. Fidel is known in the area for being a hard worker and very responsible. He's worked as a street vendor ever since he was a child. His mother had him when she was very young and subsequently had to leave him in search of better opportunities in Argentina. She left him in the care of his grandmother and three uncles. Fidel says that he's happy with his work and thanks to his effort and sacrifice he's earning many projects. He would like a loan to buy shoes and uniforms to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes and uniforms to sell

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar A. is a 28-year-old trader who has been selling food products in his own store for the last eight years. Ilqar is married and has three children. He takes responsibility for them and is trying his best to make the best future for them. His dream is to provide them with the best education.
Ilqar works very hard every day including weekends because he also works as a videotape operator making videos of local weddings. This is his second source of income but weddings happen very rarely. Ilqar is putting all of his effort into increasing income from his store. He has applied for a loan of $2000 US to purchase more goods and to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Khalida Parveen M. Ameen Shahzad Group

texts.en:
Khalida parveen baji is 51 year old married lady and a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 27 years. Her husband’s name is M. A. S. and he has a scrap business. He 5 years experience in this business. 
Khalida baji has two sons and her sons work with their father. Khalida baji is an older lady, so she spends most of her time in the house and does household work and takes care of her family. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for the fourth time to buy scrap for her husband’s scrap business.

 She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy vehicles oil to sell. Jamila kosar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Azra baji wants a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members. Each of the women will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn D. is a mother of two children and lives in Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro city. Her husband works as a gold miner using the traditional way of mining. She manages a variety store to support her husband financially. Every week she purchases additional grocery items. She needs on an average PHP 4000 to buy all the items that her store needs. Genalyn is determined to do this business as it brings extra income for the family. She is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Elemmelic

texts.en:
Elemmelic B. is 26 years old and still single. She and four family members happily live in the rural village of Baranggay Tandul, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their village is well irrigated and rice farming is their major source of income. Elemmelic gladly shared that, through her business, she is able to assist her parents in sending her sibling to school. 

Elemmelic is requesting to borrow PHP 9,000. She will use the loan for the improvement of her general store which she has operated for more than two years. She also believes that bringing out the best could be the best motivating factor to become successful someday.

loans.use: To improve her general store

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma M. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 37 years old. Wilma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ice cream in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Wilma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Wilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La sra. Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera  y madre de 04 hijos  y no tiene estudios, vive en el Jr. Las Kanteras s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 06 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para su negocio de venta de comida. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de arroz, fideos, aceite, papa, etc. Para la preparación de comida.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan las reuniones, las charlas y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Mercedes belongs to the "Medalla Milagrosa" Communal Bank, which is located in the Pomata district in the province of Chucuito in the Puno area. She is 53 years old and is a single mother with 4 children. She has not had an education and she lives on Jr. Las Kanteras Street. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used in her food-selling business. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 600 nuevos soles to buy rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, etc. for food preparation. Her wish is to continue working to settle family expenses. She likes gatherings, chats and meetings between Communal Banks.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Devota

texts.en:
Greetings from B. DEVOTA, a 40-year-old married woman with eight children born in 1992, 1994, 1996, 1998, 2000, 2002, 2004, and 2006 and 12 dependents. This big family lives in Kicukiro district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda. This entrepreneur does her business in Kicukiro where she sells her food. B. Devota has been doing the same business since 2000 and she obtains a monthly profit of $272. She has twelve full-time workers that help her run her business. She starts her daily operations at 9:00 AM and finishes at 9:00 PM.


B. Devota is seeking her first loan of 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company SA and with this loan, she intends to buy a lot materials. With the increased profit from the loan, she hopes to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients

loans.name: Silvia María

texts.es: Doña Silvia Maria de 34 años de edad, es una mujer esforzada y trabajadora, tiene una pequeña pulpería y lava y plancha ajeno para obtener otros ingresos,  desde hace diez año se gana la vida ya que se caso joven y tiene dos hijos de 5 y 10 años de edad,  los cuales los tiene estudiando, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja elaborando vitrinas, con este crédito quiere  construir un porche para tener mejor comodidad con el espacio lo cual comprara materiales de construcción . Da las gracias a la institución por los préstamo con este es su quinto ciclo y ha logrado invertir en su venta como en las mejoras de su casa.
texts.en:
Doña Silvia María, aged 34, got married at a young age and is now the mother of two children, aged 5 and 10, who attend school. She lives in the neighborhood of Hialeah in the capital city of Managua. Her husband produces showcases.

Silvia María is an enthusiastic and hard-working woman. She has a small convenience store. She also washes and irons for other people to earn more money. She made a living this way for the last ten years.

Silvia María applies for this loan to buy construction materials and build a porch for better comfort on her property. This is her fifth loan cycle. She thanks our institution for the support given to her through the previous loans, which she used to invest in her store and in home improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta I. (0) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Lalovaea. She is married and has five school-aged children. Eseta owns and operates a business selling home products, primarily selling lighting products to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 520 WST a month. In 2006, Eseta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,700 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eseta is now requesting a new loan of 2,050 WST which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is 50 years old and married with six children between 18 and 25 years. Only two of her children go to school. Hajara resides in and rents a two-room house where she is staying with eight people. There is electricity but no piped water at home. Hajara doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala and works two days a week. Hajara sells to all categories of people. Hajara deals in cattle. She buys cows from villages and sells them to meat packers and at times to Kampala city abattoir. She incurs extra transport costs to and from the villages. The major challenges she faces in her business are seasonality and the increasing prices of cattle. Hajara has been in this business for two years. She first dealt in tomatoes.  She has been with MCDT for seven years, servicing her 14th loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more cattle for resale.  Hajara aspires to see her business grow bigger and own a permanent home and a butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for resale

loans.name: Thoun

texts.en:
Mr. Thoun K., aged 30 and his wife, Mrs. Many Sieng, aged 28, live on an island on the MeK. River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2000 and have one son, who is in a local school. 

Thoun and his wife are garment factory workers. Besides this, his wife is also a hairdresser. But, she does not have enough materials for operating her business, so Thou is requesting his first loan of $300 in order to purchase materials for his wife’s business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his wife’s hairdressing business.

loans.name: Paulo Kipkurui

texts.en:
Paulo is 24 years old and married. His dairy business is located at Tembeleo in Eldoret.

He was introduced to KADET,a Kiva partner, by a group member. With the loan he is taking from KADET, he plans to buy a cow. His future plan is to carry on as a dairy farmer and to be able to supply milk and meet the family's basic needs.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a cow for his dairy-supply business

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em P. is 25 years old and a resident of Pursat province, Cambodia. She makes a living raising pigs, which she sells for slaughter four months after starting to raise them. She has been raising pigs for about three years and is currently earning around $3 a day.

Em P. is married with two children and both are going to the local public school. She is married to Chea Cheat, 23 years old, who works with her in raising pigs. Em P. and her husband are shown in the photo.

Because her pig-raising business is the main source of family income, Em P. applied for a loan to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Charles Wambua

texts.en:
Charles is a married man.  He and his wife Florence have five children together: P., Mutisya, Musyoki, Mouo and Muli.

Charles was introduced to KADET through other KADET clients, and he is now taking out his second loan with them.  He has been running a general shop for two years, and with this loan he intends to add stock of sugar, maize flour and charcoal to his inventory. His business is situated in a slum area which is nevertheless vibrant and has many customers. With the extra profits from his loan he plans to sell charcoal wholesale.  Charles believes he is hardworking, and also hopes to develop a piece of land and build rental houses to earn an income from the rent.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services which will improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. More information about KADET is available on their website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, maize flour and charcoal to his inventory

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
El  Señor Caceres es cliente recurrente de la fundacion, es propietario de una despensa y  ademas posee un taller mecanico.El negocio cuenta con 5 años de antigüedad con un importante número de clientela.
El Señor Alexis presenta un cumplimiento excelente  con el pagp de sus cuotas  y en esta ocación pretende obtener una segunda operacion de crédito con la fundacion.
Con este credito el cliente comprara mercaderias de temporada navideña como sidras, articulos navideños y otros, antes que suban de precio.
El mismo agredece la ayuda brindada por la Fundación ya que con la mismo pudo lograr mejorar las condiones de las actividades a que se dedica con su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Caceres is a recurring client of the foundation. He owns a grocery store, and he also has a mechanic’s shop. The business is five years old, and it has a good number of customers. Alexis has an excellent record of making his payments. He now wants a second loan from the Foundation. With this loan he will buy merchandise like cider, Christmas articles, and other things for the Christmas season, before they rise in price. He is grateful to the Foundation for the help, which enabled him to improve the condition of his businesses that he works at with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to stock his business with Christmas products

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is forty-two years old. She is a wife and the mother of three children. She trades in ‘batik tie and dye’. Batik tie and dye is a locally made fabric designed with dye. It is mostly patronized by traditional women for various fabric designs for different occasions.

Vivian wants to use the loan to purchase batik tie and die in bulk, and also include the sale of lace cloth. Vivian is anticipating higher profit in the coming Christmas season and she hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk.

loans.name: Delina

texts.es:
La señora Delina,  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Ana”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia D. Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 65 años tiene 03 hijos, los 03 ya son independientes.  

Delina, es una mujer trabajadora y con su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. Venta D. Cosméticos D. la línea Esika, y Oriflame, sin tener que tener un jefe y horario. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo D. actividad.

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada, ella venD. al contado y al crédito con pagos D. manera diaria, semanal quincenal o mensual.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 800.00, comprará productos D. belleza como: colonias, esmaltes, bisutería como aretes, collares y anillos, así como perfumes para varón que salen en ofertas, quiere tener surtido su negocio y dar una buena  atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Delina, sueña con crecer en este negocio y llegar a ser una vendedora estrella para ganar buenos premios. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Delina is a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank, which is in the District and Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martín. She is 65 years old, married, and the mother of three children who are independent.

Delina is a working woman who has always had a fighting spirit and the desire to succeed. With her own resources, she started a business selling cosmetics from the Esika and Oriflame lines.
