She neither reports to a boss nor has a set schedule. Gradually she has become known among her customers and today she says her business is doing very well. She currently has a loyal clientele. Delina sells her products through cash payments or credit installments on a daily, weekly, biweekly, or monthly basis.

With her loan of 800 soles, she will buy beauty products, such as perfumes, nail polishes, costume jewelry (necklaces and rings), and men’s cologne. Delfina wants her business to be well-stocked so that she can give her customers good service and proviD. them with what they need. She dreams of growing her business and becoming one of the top sellers in order to win prizes. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Delfina has been able to continue her business along with many other women who want to grow personally and as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Abdulai S. is a trader and has a stall where he sells men's jeans and clothes. He is married and his wife has a business selling local foods. They have two children and employ one assistant in the stall.

The stall is well located along one of the major roads in Bo city and is easily reached by his customers.

Abdul has about ten years experience in business.  He is seeking a loan to buy jeans and other men's wear from Guinea and Gambia to meet his customers' needs.

He plans to use the proceeds of his loan to start the construction of his house and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde lives in Lagos state. She sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is happily married and her husband is a pastor. She is without a child. 

She is very enthusiastic about the growth of her business; that is why she hopes for a loan of 90,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock and sell charcoal

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: En el municipio de Somotillo comarca el guasaule la señora Juana H. se dedica a actividades agropecuarias las que desarrolla junto a su esposo ya que ella no tiene ningún hijo, los principales rubros que desarrolla son la crianza de ganado bovino, porcino y aviar, y establece ciertos cultivos como maíz y sorgo con los que asegura su mantención y de sus animales para el verano, también desarrolla ciertas actividades comerciales como la venta de carne de cerdos y nacatamales con que obtiene ingresos para su mantención familiar, la señora Juana H. ha tenido tres créditos con los que ha comprado parte del ganado que ahora ella tiene sin embargo ella espera seguir aumentando este rubro productivo pues según ella esto a mejoardo su situación económica.
texts.en:
In the town of Somotillo, Guasaule region, Sra. Juana Hernandez makes a living farming, a business that she was able to build shoulder to shoulder with her husband because she doesn't have children. She raises livestock: cattle, pigs and chickens. She also cultivates crops such as maize and sorghum, a source of income for maintaining both herself and her animals. She earns extra money by selling pork and nacatamales (a local dish), money that goes to supporting the family. Juana has used three past loans to buy some of the cattle that she now owns. She hopes to continue developing this line of business because, she assures us, it has improved her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock and supplies for livestock business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Ms. N. Aida is forty-three years old and she owns a boutique in Portbell, Kitintale Kampala. She has been operating the business for over ten (10) years. She is requesting the loan to purchase and stock more clothes and more shoes for sale. She is a hard-working business woman whose future hope is to open up another clothes shop.

loans.use: To purchase and stock more clothes and more shoes for sale

loans.name: Iris Esperanza

texts.es:
la señora Iris Esperanza V. tiene 30 años de edad, tiene 04 hijos que dependen de ella.
Iris trabaja duro en la elaboracion de tortillas y golosinas, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. nos comento que trabaja fuerte para poder salir adelante ya que el padre de sus hijos se fue a vivir a estados unidos, desde alla le envia dinero para poder cubrir los gastos de sus 4 hijos.
tiene un proyecto el cual es terminar de construir su casa.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar harina de maiz, leña y cal para la elaboracion de tortillas.
observamos que Iris es una persona que no habla mucho pero bien dinamica y con muchos deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Mrs. Iris Esperanza is 30 years old and has 4 children who depend on her. For 5 years now, Iris has worked hard making tortillas and delicacies. She tells us that she has worked hard to be able to get ahead since the father of her children went to the United States. From afar, he sends money to help cover the costs of their 4 children. Her project is to finish constructing her house. The loan will be used to buy corn meal, fire wood and lime for making tortillas to sell. We observed that Iris is a person who doesn't talk much but is very dynamic, with much desire to advance.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CORN MEAL, LIME, AND FIRE WOOD TO MAKE TORTILLAS TO SELL

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en: Adelyn, 26, is a rice farmer and mother of a three-year-old child in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Her business is a big help to her family, as It is there where they get the food they eat everyday and also how they can pay the amount borrowed from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. Adelyn also sells dried fish for additional capital.  She currently lacks the capital to provide all the farm supplies needed for her farm and so is requesting a loan of 15,000 Php  from CEVI, a loan that will really help her business venture.

loans.use: Farm supplies and dried fish

loans.name: Jawad Malek Zada Group

texts.en:
Jawad is the son of M. B. J. and is the leader of Jawad M. Zada Group. He is 20 years old, is single, and lives in 8th district, Kabul, Afghanistan.

Jawad has a general store and works hard to earn money for the support of his family’s requirements. He needs to buy more food, beverages and other things for his business because he has lots of problems in his life.

Jawad wants to take a loan and he is very glad that has the chance to progress in his life. He would like to thank all Kiva lenders a lot.

loans.use: To buy more food, beverages and other things for his store

loans.name: Kiduusu Women's Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
She goes by the name of N. Sarah, a 30-year-old evergreen entrepreneurial upstart, being that she is only five years into her bar business in Kiduusu, Lugazi. With this business she has given all her five children a worthwhile education as she works hand in hand with her husband.

Casting her mind back in perspective to when she was still a farmer, Sarah says she has no nostalgic feelings or regrets as her financial position since then has tremendously gotten a boost. Though only still a fledgling, her bar business has given her that leverage and flexibility which she, at the threshold, did not envisage.

Sarah also ekes out profits selling bananas and vegetables that she buys from farmers. By and large, she reveals she makes monthly profits to the tune of 140,000 shillings. With this loan, she wants to inject more capital into her business with a set objective of making more profits. Principally she wants to buy more crates of beer and soda for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer and soda for her bar

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva T. is from the village of  Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old. Nieva is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Nieva owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nieva has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nieva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nieva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nieva is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Nieva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es: Bertila tiene 54 años, vive en compañía D. su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 35 años se ha dedicado al negocio, en un inicio frutas, actualmente gelatina, postre que ella misma prepara, siendo su principal herramienta D. trabajo, su refrigeradora. DesD. entonces y todas las mañanas venD. este postre D. manera ambulante, afirma que los días que más venD. es en temporada D. verano. Se siente muy motivada, porque luego D. varias horas D. caminata, regresa a su casa sin gelatina y con las ganancias en sus manos, pueD. cubrir sus gastos domésticos. Su deseo es mejorar su negocio con nuevos implementos. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. insumos que necesita como gelatina D. diversos sabores, vasitos y cucharitas descartables.
texts.en:
Bertila is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their four children. She has been in business for more than 35 years. Bertila started selling fruits, but now she sells gelatins and desserts that she prepares herself. The main piece of equipment that she uses for work is her refrigerator. Every morning she sells these desserts as a street vendor. Bertila says the days when she sells the most are during the summer season. She feels very motivated after several hours of walking because she gets to return home without any gelatins and with all the money she has earned in her hands. These funds go toward covering her household expenses. Her wish is to improve her business with new implements.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. Bertila is very happy to know that she has financial backing, which is why she has already proven herself to be responsible with her payments. In addition, she is glad to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and cooperative people. She will invest her loan in the purchase of supplies that she needs such as gelatins of different flavors and disposable cups and spoons.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gelatins of different flavors and disposable cups and spoons

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Lucia nace hace más de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité en estos dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Mirian quien se dedica a la venta de frutas en su casa en una casilla que tiene.
Ella ademas recorre por el barrio para vender sus frutas, a los negocios y otros.
La actividad le ayuda y para ella es muy importante para la alimentacion de su familia.
Ella es esta oportunidad solicita el prestamo para la compra de mas frutas como naranjas, manznas, frutillas, peras, platanos y otros.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucia Committee was started more than two years ago with the help of another committee that works in the same area. During this time, the members have grown socially as well as financially. They are known in their area for being hardworking women.

One of the members is Sra. Mirian who sells fruit from a booth near her home. She also travels around the neighborhood selling fruits to businesses and other people. This activity is very important since it helps to feed her family. Mirian is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy more fruits such as oranges, apples, strawberries, pears, bananas, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oranges, apples, strawberries, pears, bananas, and other products

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
N. Hellen is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera, in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For over a year now, Hellen has been running her own poultry-rearing business to make a living.          

To help expand her business, Hellen is now requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chicken for rearing, and Hellen hopes that the expansion will increase her business profits and allow her to afford to buy sufficient food and, in the future, pay for her university studies.

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: Purchase of chicken and chicken feed

loans.name: Lilian Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Lilian M. se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de comida, Lilian cuenta con un negocio que opera bajo el nombre de Comedor “San Simón” ubicado en la Terminal de buses de Danli, contando con seis (6) años de experiencia en la administración del mismo.
Este negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, ya que es allí en donde se reune la mayor parte de personas que viajan de las aldeas a la ciudad que son las personas que representan la mayor parte de su clientela.
La Sra. M. vive en unión libre y su compañero de hogar labora como revisor de puros en una fabrica de tabacos, tienen 4 hijos los cuales dependen a un 100% de ellos y con los ingresos que le genera el negocio ella colabora a su esposo a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materiales para la fabricacion de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Lilian M. is a businesswoman. Her main activity is food sales. Lilian has a business called Comedor San Simón, located in the Danli bus terminal, and she has six years of experience running this business. This business is in a strategic location, since it is where most of the people who travel from the towns to the city meet, and these people represent most of her customers. Mrs. M. is in a relationship, and her partner works as a cigar inspector in a tobacco factory. They have four children who depend 100% on them, and with the income from her business she works with her partner to cover certain household expenses. She will use the loan to buy materials for making her foods.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pork, beef, chicken, tortillas, vegetables, lard, oil, soft drinks, condiments, eggs, dairy products, sausages, bread, coffee, juice

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
This is Beatriz C., 55, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo C., a driver, and is the mother of a young adult enrolled in college and an elementary-aged youngster. By the grace of God, Beatriz has managed to support her older child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her youngest to college. This is the dream of most Filipino parents like Beatriz, who herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.
Beatriz operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Beatriz earns an income by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piece rate. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, Beatriz is requesting a loan of 39,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Beatriz dreams of having franchises and branches of her store. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To expand her product inventory by purchasing groceries, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Benadette

texts.en:
Benadette N. O. is a married lady with four children between 16 and 21 years old. Her business is located at the Mikindani estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many many tourist-attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches. 

She has been selling such items as rice, flour, oil, detergents, soft drinks, etc., for the last six years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more general items to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. She also hopes to open other shops in other areas. She describes herself as welcoming.

loans.use: Flour, cooking oil, detergents, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg B. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and 25-year-old daughter in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her husband works as a driver for the local main hospital while her daughter is a doctor in the same hospital. 

Oyunchimeg operates a hair and beauty salon in her town along with four of her partners. They share the rent of a rented room to operate their salon named " Nahia Uschin". She has been working as a hairdresser since 1982 and has developed much experience. Her earnings have enabled her not only to provide for her family but also to pay her three children's tuition fees. She says, "I would like to open my own beauty and hair salon in the future." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary supplies such as gel, foam, cream, hair color, etc. for her hair salon.

loans.use: To purchase necessary supplies

loans.name: Ilsen Maria

texts.es: Ilsen de 29 años es una joven muy entusiasta. Inicio hace 9 años atrás vendiendo muy pocos productos como ropa y cosméticos más tarde, como le genero buenos ingreso decidió invertir una parte de las ganancias en mercadería variada  Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo surtir su negocio. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.  Aunque la venta de contado le genera mejores ganancias ella también le gusta vender de manera ambulante así le da oportunidad de conocer a mas clientes. Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa, cosméticos, calzado y toallas para venderla a sus vecinos y así tener un ingreso adicional. En el futuro quiere tener su negocio más estable y seguro.
texts.en:
Ilsen, 29, is a very enthusiastic young woman. Nine years ago she began selling just a few products such as clothing and cosmetics. Later as this generated a good income she decided to invest part of the earnings in a variety of merchandise. Little by little and with effort she was able to stock her business. Currently she works from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. Although cash sales generate better earnings for her, she also likes to sell her merchandise as a street vendor as this gives her the opportunity to meet more customers. 

With the loan she wants to buy clothing, cosmetics, footwear and towels for selling to her neighbors and thus bring in additional income. In the future she wants to have a more stable, steady business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es: Oscar Manuel tiene 30 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy gratificante, esta no es la primera vez que solicita crédito y todo lo que ha logrado es por medio de financiamientos es que ha mejorado. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra materia prima como sabanas, toallas, perfumes, cremas y ropa en general. El sueño de de Oscar es agrandar su negocio y establecerse en el mercado en donde todos los días asisten muchos clientes.
texts.en: Oscar Manuel is 30 years old.  He works selling general merchandise.  He has had this business for more than 2 years and it has been very rewarding.  This is not the first time that he has requested a loan and all that he has achieved has been as a result of the loans which have helped him to improve.  He is requesting this loan so that he can buy supplies such as sheets, towels, perfume, creams and clothes.  Oscar's dream is to expand his business and set up in the market where there are many customers every day.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zamu

texts.en:
Zamu T. lives in the Kawempe Mbogo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her old mother. Zamu lives in a home that she owns and she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.   

Zamu has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works six days out of every week. Zamu sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail.

Zamu has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.

The main business challenges for Zamu include thieves, the rainy season and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Sergio Edgardo

texts.es: Sergio Edgardo E. M. de 28 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa, una hija de 1 año de edad y junto a sus padres. Sergio posee un pequeño consultorio en cual esta en su casa de habitación, él es un joven quien ha estudiado mucho para poder brindar un excelente servicio. Sergio solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar diferentes máquinas como básculas, estetoscopios, entre otros más. De esta manera él espera tener muy bien equipado su consultorio ya que de esta forma podrá brindar un mejor servicio y así mismo contar con más pacientes.
texts.en:
Sergio Edgardo Eguizábal M., 28, lives in San Salvador department with his wife, one year old daughter and his parents.

He has a small doctor’s office in his home.  He is a young man who has studied a lot in order to provide excellent service.

He is asking for a loan to buy several pieces of equipment like scales and stethoscopes, among others, hoping thus to have a very well-equipped doctor’s office to provide better service and at the same time have more patients.

loans.use: To buy equipment for a medical office.

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
This is 26 year-old Nirmala S..  She is married and has 2 children aged 10 and 5.  In 2005, she established  her tea shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy food materials for her business.  In the future, Nirmala plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: to buys food materials for her shop

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok H. is 39 years old.  His wife, Mrs. La Nat, is 31 years old.  They are pictured here with their young daughter.  They live in a small village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They have been married since 1994 and have three children – two sons and one daughter, one is in school and other two are still young. 

Sok is a rice farmer and a fisherman. His wife is a weaver. He is applying for a loan of $100 to help him farm rice.

loans.use: To use for rice farming

loans.name: Doris Marlendi

texts.es: Doris Marlendi tienwe 25 años es una persona responsable, es casada con Samuel Gonzalez, ella se dedica a la venta de maiz por mayor y otros productos como alfrecho,etc es una que es muy reconocida por sus clientes por su amavilidad con que trata a su clientes ella dice que su credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de maiz por mayor ya que desea agrandar mas sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a su esposo con el sustento de su hogar ella esta agradecida con Fape y kiva porue le han ayudado mucho con los creditos ya que por medio de ello ella a podido agrandar mas su negocio su sueño es poder tener mas bariedad en producto para responder a la demanda que sus clientes le hacen ella esta segura que con la ayuda de Dios lo ba a lograr.
texts.en: Doris Marlendi is a responsible 25-year-old woman who is married to Samuel Gonzalez. She sells corn wholesale, as well as other products like bran, etc. She is very well-known by her customers for her kindness that she shows them. She states that she is requesting this loan to purchase corn wholesale because she would like to increase sales and earn a higher income so that she can help her husband support their household. She is grateful to Fape and Kiva because they have helped her a lot with these loans since she has been able to expand her business. Her dream is to be able to offer a greater variety of products to meet customer demand. She is sure that she will achieve this with the help of God.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale corn

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
El comité “Divino Niño Jesús” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
La Señora Marta es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de jabón en polvo y también es empleada doméstica.
Ella tiene una familia constituida por dos hijos, y su marido es chofer.
La señora Marta solicita el crédito para comprar más cantidad de jabón en polvo.
texts.en:
The “Divino Nño Jesús” (Divine Child Jesus) committee is made up of a group of neighbors from the town of Mariano Roque Alonso.

Marta is one of the committee's members.  Her business is selling soap powder and she is also a cleaner.  Marta has two children and her husband is a driver.  She is requesting this loan to buy more soap powder.

loans.use: To buy soap powder

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 40 years old and has 7 children, who are between the ages of 2 and 17 years old. Vestine has a restaurant, and she is requesting a loan to purchase food stuffs, such as Irish potatoes, sodas, and fresh milk. With the profits, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: Purchase food stuffs.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha es cliente nueva  es su primer crédito con nuestra institución,  ella es propietaria de un vehículo minibús,  esta  afiliado en el sindicato, la Sra. Martha trabaja como ayudante en  su minibús para reducir  gastos  con su esposo  Max quien es el conductor, la Sra. Martha se encarga de cobrar y de vocear,  viven en la zona Urkupiña Ambos realizan el  trabajo constante  para cumplir con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia con expectativa de mejores logros, son muy trabajadores, la Sr. Martha esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Martha is a new client and this is her first loan with our institution.  She is the owner of a minibus, and is affiliated with a union.  Martha works as a money collector in the bus with her husband to reduce costs.  Max is the driver, and Martha takes the money and yells out for people's stops.  They live in the area known as Urkupiña.  They both work constantly to meet their goal of improving their family's quality of life.  They work very hard because they expect to achieve a lot.  Martha is grateful to the institution for the help they have given her.

loans.use: Engine maintenance and ring change

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor Maria V. M. tiene 24 años, en unión libre vive con el compañero y con los hijos en le Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se reúnen en la ciudadela 24 de Mayto está ventanilla se dedica a actividades comerciales como la vetan de perfumes, ropa, bisutería y otros son comerciantes de carne.

Flor Maria se dedica a la comercialización de venta de cometidos como Yambal por pedidos en revistas, las compras las realiza por medio de una llamada telefónica y las vente por medio de revista puerta a puerta. 

Solicita el crédito para adquirir los productos por medio de catalogo y tener los productos en una tienda,  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y los precios altos. Su sueño es progresar en su negocio.

Le gusta  hacer ejercicios.
texts.en:
Flor Maria V. M. is 24 years old and lives with her partner and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 2 children.

The 'ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA' community bank is located in Ventanas canton.  Its members meet in '24 de Mayo' neighborhood.  They work in commercial activities such as selling perfume, clothes and costume jewelry.  Other are meat sellers.

Flor Maria sells cosmetics such as Yambal cosmetics to order through catalogs.  She makes her purchases with a telephone call and sells her products door to door through a catalog.

Flor Maria is requesting this loan to acquire her products through a catalog and to have the products in a store.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as competition and high prices.  Her dream is to make progress in her business.

Flor Maria enjoys doing exercises.

loans.use: to buy products through a catalog

loans.name: Maria Transito

texts.es:
María de 49 años, es una mujer trabajadora que inicio en la venta de carbón mediante un vecino que se cambio de casa y no había quien lo vendiera.

Ella labora sola en sus ventas de carbón diariamente o cuando su clientes le pidan. Con el préstamo va a comprar cerámicas para aumentar su productividad. En un futuro quiere implementar su negocio de tienda con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who started selling charcoal through a neighbor who was moving house and didn't have anybody to sell to her.

María works alone in her charcoal business.  She makes her sales every day or whenever her customers request it.  María will use this loan to buy ceramics to increase her productivity.  In the future, she would like to stock her business with new products.

loans.use: to buy ceramics

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
H. Trương Thị (20203050052) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children. H. owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month.


In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.496.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. H. is now requesting a new loan of 7.840.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be her 3rd loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Trương Thị (20203050052) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  thanh toán tiền học phí của con của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Hector Nicolas

texts.es:
Hector de 44 años, es un hombre  trabajador que un dia cambio su activida economica por un accidente que tuvo el antes era maestro albañil y eso lo dejo por un tiempo sin trabajao que sdecidio transportar al sus cliente del mercado a sus respetivas hogares.

El labora todos los dias en el mercado esperando a sus cliente en las compras que realizan y llevarlas a sus casas. Esta casso, su esposa trabaja como docente en una escuela y tien hijos ya mayores que tambien lo ayuda en su trabajos. Con el prestamo quiere comprarse una moto para asi adaptarla con el triciclo para poder hacer sus transportes mas rapidos y tener mas ingresos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Hector, age 44, is a hardworking man who had to change his job due to an accident that he had. Prior to that, he was a construction foreman, and the accident has left him without work for some time. This is why he decided to offer a service of transporting clients from the market to their respective homes.

Hector works every day, waiting for clients to finish their purchases so that he could take them home. His wife works as a teacher at a school, and their children are already grown and help him in his work. Hector will use the loan to purchase a motorcycle that he plans to outfit with a tricycle passenger cabin so that he could transport his fares more quickly and generate a higher level of income in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: En Managua capital de Nicaragua, el señor Pablo Emilio posee su familia a la que proporciona las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen. Él siempre ha velado por el bienestar de su hogar y para ello hace uso de los créditos proporcionados por Ceprodel. Esta vez, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de algunos materiales de construcción tales como arena, cemento, zinc y perlines para realizar cambio de techo porque al entrar el invierno dicha vivienda debe estar muy segura y protegida. Está confiando en que su crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en: En Managua, Nicaragua's capital, Mr. Pablo Emilio lives with his family, for whom he must provide necessary living conditions. He has always worried for the well-being of his home and for that reason he has asked for loans from Ceprodel. This time, he is asking for a loan to buy some construction materials such as sand, cement, zinc and beams to get a new roof. Since winter is coming, the roof must be secure and protect the home. He is confident that his loan will go well.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve his roof.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia  es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Ella estudió cosmetología.
Zenobia es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicitará un préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio, ella ofrece el servicio de cosmetología, además se dedica a la venta  y recarga de celulares.  Con éste préstamo comprará accesorios para su salón de belleza y celulares.  Nos  cuenta que trabaja sola ya que su esposo trabaja en la mina. 
Su sueño es tener una empresa de reparación de celulares y vender accesorios al por mayor.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias ya que comparten experiencias  que le servirán para el futuro.
texts.en:
Zenobia is a member of the communal bank "3 de Mayo" [May 3rd] located in the llave [i-l-a-v-e] district in the province of El Collao and department of Puno. She is thirty years old, in a committed relationship, and has two children. She studied cosmetology in school. 

Zenobia is a new member who recently came to work with the Manuela Ramos Movement. She will be seeking a loan in the amount of 500 nuevos soles, money that she will invest in her business. She offers cosmetology services and in addition sells cell phones and cell phone minutes. 

With this loan she will buy accessories for her beauty salon and cell phones. She tells us that she works alone since her husband works in the mines. Her dream is to have a cell phone repair business and to sell accessories wholesale. 

What she likes about the communal bank are the meetings with the members, since they share experiences which will help her down the road.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for her beauty salon and cell phones.

loans.name: Maurito

texts.en:
Maurito is 47 years old and married with four children. The oldest child is 22 and the youngest is 17. 

Maurito is a farmer who tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato. He grows rice and corn crops, pineapples and bananas. Maurito also started a sari-sari store that his wife manages. Maurito works hard to provide the needs of his family. He requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

In the future, Maurito hopes to expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower is 45 years old. She is married and has 4 children ages 4, 6, 9 and 15 years old. In 1997, she established her provisions (milk, sardine, margarine, sugar etc.) business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income and establish a savings account. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 850,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to add to capital to her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. 

In the future, she plans to visit pilgrimage land (Mecca), continue to support her husband, and construct a house. Transportation and frequent increase in the cost of stocks are her biggest challenges. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for assorted provisions such as milk, sardine, margarine, sugar etc. for her business

loans.name: Cristhian Guadalupe

texts.es: Cristhiam de 39 años de edad es madre soltera de una niña de 6 añitos, trabaja como maestra de primaria desde hace 22 años. Esta solicitando su 9no credito para continuar mejorando su casa, pues KIVA ya le ha dado su apoyo con los 3 ultimos creditos que solicito para construir su casa la cual esta haciendo de 2 pisos; ya hizo los cuartos y ahora quiere construir la parte de enfrente de la segunda planta por lo que solicita se le financie el credito y asi terminar la obra que con mucho esfuerzo ha hecho durante estos ultimos 4 años, ya que la mejora la ha hecho en varias etapas, porque no cuenta con el suficiente ingreso economico para hacerlo todo.  El mayor sueño que tiene es poder darle las mejores condiciones de vida a su bebita que es la razon de su vida y a quien desea darle las mejores condiciones para que crezca en un ambiente comodo y agradable.
texts.en:
Cristhian is 39 years old.  She is a single mother and has a 6 year-old daughter.  She has worked as an elementary school teacher for 22 years old.

Cristhian is requesting her ninth loan so that she can continue improving her home.  Kiva have already supported her with her three most recent loans which allowed her to build her home.  She is building a two-storey home and has already finished the rooms.  She would now like to build the front part of the second floor.  This is why she is requesting this loan.  She will thereby be able to finish the work that she has carried out with a lot of effort over the past four years.  She has done the work in several stages as she doesn't have enough income to do it all at once.

Cristhian's biggest dream is to be able to provide her little girl with better living conditions as she means the world to her.  She would like to provide her with better living conditions so that she can grow up in a comfortable and pleasant environment.

loans.use: to build the front part of the second floor of her home

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has operated a food stall business for the past six years, selling from her home to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season when business is slow. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Fatuma and her husband own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Their greatest monthly expense is food for the family. They have two children, one of whom has graduated from school and one of whom is still too young for school. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she has requested, Fatuma wants to renovate her food stall and to purchase bales of maize flour and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to renovate her food stall and to purchase bales of maize flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Viviana Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Viviana, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 12, 11 años  y un bebito de 1 año de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es mecánico automotriz.
 
Ella es una gran madre y ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta  aunque también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando tiene mercadería nueva, la mayor parte de sus ventas es bajo pedido que le realizan sus clientes. Su mercadería la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada fin de mes o cuando necesita. Lleva cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal 4 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco.
 
Sus sueños es tener su casa propia ya que arrienda donde vive.
texts.en:
The communal bank Camino Al Progreso [Road to Progress] gathers every two weeks in the Montecristi hamlet, known for its rich precolonial culture and its handicraft which is renowned nationally and internationally, the place of the famous Panama hats. 

In this place lives Ms. Viviana, 28, who lives in a committed relationship by which she has three children of 12 and 11 years and a little baby who is one. The two elder children are in high school and elementary school. The husband is an automotive mechanic. 

She is a great mother and housewife who, in order to help her husband with household expenses, devotes herself to selling all types of clothing. Her manner of selling is door-to-door although she also sells from home, where her customers come when she has new merchandise. The majority of her sales are pre-ordered by her customers. She goes to buy her merchandise in Guayaquil at the end of every month or whenever it is necessary. She has been in this business for five years and it is going quite well. 

She will use this loan to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing. She has been with the communal bank for four years and she likes it because of the help she receives from the bank. 

Her dreams are to have her own home since she currently is renting.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is from the village Kakabeti in the Kakheti Region. She is 37 years old, unmarried, and lives with her sister Maka, mother, aunt and uncle. Nani and Maka work in the village school. Nani is a teacher and Maka is a school accountant. Nani’s mother, and aunt and uncle are retired. Along with her job, Nani is actively involved in the family agricultural business. The family has a small dairy farm with two cows. Nani sells milk and yogurt to local dairy-product retailers. The family also has one hectare of land where grapes are grown. A portion of the grapes are sold locally, and the rest are used for wine-making. Nani and Maka sell wine in the village. 

Nani requested credit to purchase drugs for treatment of the grapevines for parasites. Also, a small part of the credit will be used for some renovation work in the house. After treating the vineyard, Nani will get a good harvest, and sell it for a convenient price. It will positively impact the income of the family. At the same time, after renovation of the house, the family will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase drugs to treat grapevines for parasites, and materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Vilma; tiene 53 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya todos son independientes, la socia trabaja en una agencia de viajes ella es considerada la comisionista, la socia trabaja con sus amiga la dueña y le gusta su trabajo y ahora está deseando el crédito para poder comprar bloquetas en la cantidad de un millar para construir su casa, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y sola saco adelante a sus hijos, ella ahora quiere  construir su casa y con la ayuda de sus hijos  harán todos los acabados, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un millar de bloquetas para construir su vivienda.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to CUSCO community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.  She is 53 years old, single, and has four children who all live independently.

Vilma works in a travel agency where she is a commission agent.  She works with her friend who owns the business and she enjoys her work.  She would like this loan so that she can buy one thousand blocks with which to build her house.  Vilma is a very hard-working woman who got her children ahead in life on her own.  She would like to build a house with the help of her children.  They will do all the finishing work.

Vilma is grateful for the support that she will receive and, for her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy a thousand blocks to build her house

loans.name: Chumamurod

texts.ru: Чумамурод проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Чумамурод занимается птицеводством. У него у себя дома имеется мини птицефабрика. В этой области он уже пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа кур с птицефабрики города Худжанд.
texts.en: Chumamurod lives in the town of Isfara.  He is 36 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Chumamurod is involved in poultry farming and has a mini-poultry farm at home.  He has been in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of chickens from the Khujand poultry plant.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 62 years old and lives in Nabuna, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with eight children. 

To earn a living, Enriquita has a business selling snacks such as puto, hotcakes, bibingca, etc. She earns about PHP 500 each month doing this work. Enriquita has requested a loan of 3,000 to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

Enriquita has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Enriquita would like to have more capital so that she can help her family with financial challenges.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, 51 years old, lives in Tuluan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur. She is married and blessed with 7 children. Alicia has operated a general store for more than one year. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more stock for the store.

Alicia has been a member of PAGLAUM MULTI-PURPOSE COOPERATIVE for almost two years, as she started her business. In the future, Alicia hopes that, through the help of PMPC, she can earn a lot in her business, which could help her financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Neermala

texts.en: Neermala is 27 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 11 and 6. In 2001, she established her tea shop business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy food materials for her business. In the future, Neermala plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buys food materials for her business.

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es: En una de las comunidades cercanas a la ciudad de Estelí llamada el Dorado, es una zona conocida por su alta productividad de hortalizas, este sector de la agricultura es una de la actividades mas comunes y productiva de la zona, es ahí donde vive el Joven  Jairo de 24 años de edad, el se dedica a sembrar hortalizas, siendo la cebolla uno de los principales productos que cosecha. Inicio sembrando ½ manzana de tomate, el entusiasmado dice que cuando   logro sembrar por primera vez  pues le fue muy bien  logro vender a un buen precio su primera cosecha tenia quince años, su padre le ayudo ya que fue en terrenos de su padre donde sembró por primera vez, con su primera ganancia ahorro para poder darle un techo donde vivir a su compañera de vida. Hoy en día se dedica a cultivar cebolla y tomates junto con sus hermanos quienes lo ayudan a sembrar. El solicito el crédito para compra semilla de cebolla y compra de insumos. El crédito le ayudara a comprar la semilla que es material vegetativo que necesita para cultivar. Su siguiente paso después de sembrar cebolla el quiere sembrar tomates. En sus planes futuros quiere comprar su propio terreno, comprar equipos de riego .
texts.en: In one of the communities close to the city of Estelí llamada el Dorado is an area known for its high productivity of vegetables. This agricultural sector is one of the most common and productive activities of the area. It is there where young Jairo, 24, lives. He is dedicated to growing vegetables, onion being one of the main products that he harvests. He began planting half tomatoes.The enthusiasm dictated that when he planted for the first time, it went well and he sold his first crop at a good price when he was 15 years old. His father helped him since he was in his father's land where he farmed for the first time. With his first earnings, he saved so he could put a roof where his girlfriend lived. Today he is dedicated to farming onion and tomatoes along with his brothers who help him to plant. He is requesting a loan to buy onion seed and to purchase inputs. The loan will help him to buy the seed which is vegetative material that he needs to farm. His next task, after planting onion, is to plant tomatoes. In the future, he wishes to buy his own land and to buy irrigation equipment.

loans.use: to purchase onion seed and inputs.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 59 years old. She is married with one child.

Candelaria is known as one of of the gold buyers in her village. She also do the traditional mining, called pamiling, in the village. Aside from having this source of income, she has a retail store selling a variety of goods like canned goods, biscuits, drinks, candies, noodles, breads, and more. Since her place is quiet and far from downtown, she stores only the basic needs of the villagers. Now, she requests a loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks like detergents, batteries, canned goods, and more to sell in her retail store. She will also use the money as capital in buying gold dust in the village and sell items downtown for a higher price, so she can gain additional income from being a gold buyer.
 
Candelaria has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Candelaria hopes to improve her business and the way of life her family is used to.

loans.use: To buy more gold dust from the village and to buy items like canned goods, shampoos, and snacks to sell in the sari sari store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old and married with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. A major challenge she faces in her business is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, oil, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Hamrokul

texts.ru: Хамрокул предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он пять лет. Ему 29 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Hamrokul has been running a taxi business for the last five years. He is 29 years old, married and has two children. Hamrokul needs this loan to repair his taxi cab.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: El señor Pablo es albañil y realiza construcciones en obra gruesa y fina; su esposa es comerciante y tiene una tienda de barrio. El crédito es para la compra de material (ladrillos, arena, cemento, piedra) para un contrato de trabajo de construcción que se adjudicó y le significará buenos ingresos. Pablo es casado, tiene cinco hijos. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona  de Alto Chijini  de la Ciudad de La Paz. El  cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los  créditos otorgados (ya son ocho hasta antes del presente crédito, pagados en forma satisfactoria) ya que le ayudo a incrementar sus ingresos y así ayudar a su familia. Esta es la quinta vez que su solicitud es canalizada hacia kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Pablo is a bricklayer and his work consists of building the infrastructure and the finishing details. His wife is a merchant and manages a neighborhood store. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials (bricks, sand, cement, and stone) for a construction contract that he was awarded which will generate good income. Pablo is married and has five children. He lives in his own home in the District of Alto Chijini in the city of La Paz.

Pablo is very pleased with the loans he has received since they have helped to increase his income and provide for his family. (He received eight loans prior to this one, all of which have been repaid on time.) This is the fifth time that his request is being referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a construction contract.

loans.name: Nua

texts.en:
Nua is a 70-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has eight children between the ages of 32 and 15. Two of them go to school. 

Nua runs a locally made beds business, and he has been in the business for six years. He has two employees. 

Nua heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officers’ promotion done in the market. He is taking a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase more items like rope, spare parts for making beds and many others. In addition to this business, Nua has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Nua would like to be able to buy barbules of rope for making beds.

His major challenges include his low income rate and the expense of the items. 

Nua says that he appreciates Finance Sudan’s effort in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rope and spare parts for making beds.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Matuhi Group

texts.en:
Manufred is a 36-year-old father of five children, four of whom attend primary school. He is a good farmer who has been growing maize, beans, coffee and cassava for over 22 years. He works hard while earning a low income due to crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.
Manufred is seeking funds to purchase insecticides and fertilizers for his growing crops. He dreams of expanding his production from 7 to 16 acres in the next five years in order to generate more income to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Plush and Play is a Philippine-based start-up that is offering child-friendly and environment-friendly educational toys. This group provides products and services that have direct social impact to highly skilled sewers like Fe who is one of the first sewers that it has partnered with. As part of Gawad Kalinga's social enterprise program, Plush and Play is setting-up its initial sewing center in the Gawad Kalinga Enchanted Farm in Bulacan Province, Philippines and fully supports the sustainability efforts towards a poverty free Philippines by 2024.

Plush and Play is a Filipino brand that offers fun, educational, safe and relevant toys for children. With the first line of veggie-themed sewn stuffed toys locally named Manny Pakwan ("pakwan" or watermelon), Jessica Saging ("saging" or banana), Anne Kamatis ("kamatis" or tomato) it aims to provide kids with a fun learning experience about local fruits and vegetables plus their benefits. These stuffed toys are handmade by partners from Gawad Kalinga communities, with the first sewing area planned to be set-up at the Gawad Kalinga Enchanted Farm. As it highlights the undervalued sewing and crafting skills of the nanays (mothers)like Fe, it also showcases the creative genius of the poor as all of the products are co-designed by the community partners and by young university graduates. It also directs efforts into ensuring sustainability of the communities they are partnered with, fully supporting Gawad Kalinga's campaign to provide opportunities for all.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a working space in the GK Enchanted Farm to be shared by the mothers of the community to make veggie-themed stuffed toys, garments, and other sewn items

loans.name: Fidel Moreno

texts.es: Fidel es un hombre trabajador de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos una niña de 6 años y un varón de 4 años de edad que son su mayor alegría. Fidel es un hombre responsable que buscando la manera de llevar el sustento a su familia, sale desde la madrugada para vender pan francés de forma ambulante, recorriendo las calles de su cantón y su municipio, lo que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia. Fidel desea seguir mejorando su calidad de vida, anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual le permitió instalar la puerta de su vivienda, por lo que ahora puede ofrecer a su familia un lugar seguro donde vivir, actualmente solicita un crédito el cual le permita mejorar el área de pila y lavadero de su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lámina y polines para mejorar el área del lavadero de su vivienda.

loans.use: Para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lámina y polines para mejorar el área del lavadero de su vivienda.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 49 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Marlene has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marlene requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Marlene has been in this business for twenty-five years. In the future, Marlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Adriana Monserrat

texts.en:
Adriana is a very engaging and hard working woman, married and has three small children. Her husband\'s work is occassional as an independent laborer and his income is unstable and not enough to cover the basic necessities of their household. Antonio, Adriana\'s husband, since a year and a half ago fell ill and needed urgent medical care and tests, which is when she started to sell costmetics with her objective to be able to get her husband\'s needed medical care.

It has not been an easy struggle through all this time, but the ongoing love of her family has made this possible. Now she needs a loan in the amount of $250 that she will repay in a term of 3 to 6 months. Adriana and her family need you and your support and generosity. Do not doubt and make your decision. They will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Adriana es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos pequeños. El trabajo de su marido es eventual, ya que es albañil por su cuenta, por lo que los ingresos no son seguros y no alcanzan a cubrir todas la necesidades básicas del hogar. Antonio, esposo de Adriana, hace un año y medio se enfermó y necesitaba urgentemente consultas y exámenes médicos, por lo que ella comenzó a vender cosméticos, con el objetivo de conseguir los medios necesarios para atenderlo.

No ha sido fácil luchar en todo este tiempo, pero la constancia y el amor a su familia lo han hecho posible. Ahora ella necesita de un crédito para poder continuar con su proyecto, por la cantidad de $250 dólares, mismos que planea cubrir en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Adriana y su familia necesitan de ti, de tu apoyo y generosidad, no lo dudes más y decídete, ellos te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
Born in 1975, Celine is in a polygamous marriage and mother of three children. After the death of her two children and her mother within a space of two months, and the costly procedure at the birth of her last child, Celine needed a strong support system to deal with her loss and economic issues.

She saw GHAPE as the only shoulder to lean on. Her group and center has continued to provide her with support as they share their experience. With acquired minimum marketing and management skills, she utilized and repaid her first two loans. Her goal for her next loan is to regain self-esteem through interactions and more business techniques.

With a loan of $300, she plans to increase her stock by buying raw foodstuff and fruits in bulk. The growing population of Mbemgwi, her skills and commitment in improving her situation, and the location of her business are factors indicating success. She plans to pay loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Trading and farming.

loans.name: Aide

texts.en:
Aide is 42 years old and has 4 children. She has had a grocery store for three years, where she sells food to her neighbors. She represents the Sonora 6 Group, which is a group of 4 women (including Aide) who run their own businesses to help support their families, since their husbands do not earn enough due to lack of schooling. The other women of the group are: Gloria Hernandez Lopez (grocery store), Rosalinda Garcia Ico (dairy products), Maria del C. Solis Hernandez (door to door cake sales). The loan will be divided proportionally among the group, with each one investing in her business.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

AIDE TIENE 42 AÑOS , 4 HIJOS , DESDE HACE TRES AÑOS QUE TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES DONDE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES PARA LAS PERSONAS DE SU VECINDAD, ELLA REPRESENTA AL GRUPO SONORA 6 , EL CUAL ESTA INTEGRADO POR CUATRO MUJERES ( INCLUYENDOLA ) LAS CUA.LES SE HAN ESFORZADOS TENIENDO SUS PROPIOS NEGOCIOS PARA SUSTENTAR A SU FAMILIA YA QUE SUS ESPOSOS PERCIBEN UN SALARIO MUY BAJO DEBIDO A LA FALTA DE EDUCACION QUE POSEEN . LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON : GLORIA HERNANDEZ LOPEZ ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) ROSALINDA GARCIA ICO ( VENDE PRODUCTOS LACTEOS ) MARIA DEL C. SOLIS HERNANDEZ ( VENDE PASTELES DE CASA EN CASA ) EL PRESTAMO LO DIVIDIRAN EN PARTES PROPORCIONALES ENTRE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, INVIRTIENDOLO EN CADA UNO DE SUS NEGOCIOS.

loans.use: Grocery store.

loans.name: Muattar

texts.ru:
Muattar is a teacher by profession and works in a high school. She is 44 years old and is married, but does not have children. Her husband is in Russia earning money. A teacher’s salary is not enough to live on, so she sells goods at the markets. Her sister Nasiba helps her. Muattar specialized in children’s clothing and footwear. The profits from her business help her to cover part of the family expenditures.

Her past loan from MicroInvest helped Muattar to expand her small business. She plans on using the new loan to purchase school uniforms. In the photo is her sister Nasiba. Muattar was teaching school on the day that the photo was taken.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Муаттар по образованию преподаватель и работает в средней школе. Ей 44 года , она замужем, но у нее нету детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Заработка преподавателя недостаточно и она выходит на базары торговать. Ей помогает ее сестра Насиба. Специализируется Муаттар на детских одежде и обуви. Прибыль от бизнеса позволяет покрывать часть семейных расходов. Полученный займ Микроинвест помог расширить ее маленький бизнес. В наступающий сезон продаж школьной формы она хочет получить новый займ. На фотографии ее сестра Насиба, сама Муаттар в этот день преподавала в школе.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is 38 years old and she is married to Isabelino Chávez who is 47 years old. He works for a road construction company. Thanks to his revenue, he is able to help his wife with the house’s expenses and their children’s school tuition. They have two children, one of them is 10 years old, who is in school and other is 15 years old who helps her in the business and at night he is in school. Francisca has had this business for more than 5 years. Thanks to her effort, a good administration and the help of her husband; she has been able to expand the business since she has a good clientele due to the good her location. She needs the loan to buy more merchandise as sugar, rice, noodles, pastries, sausages, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca tiene 38 años, está casada con el Sr. Isabelino Chávez de 47 años quien trabaja en una empresa constructora de rutas, gracias a su ingreso ayuda a su esposa para los gastos de la casa y el estudio de sus hijos. Tienen dos hijos, uno de 10 años quien está estudiando en la escuela y otro de 15 años quien le ayuda en el negocio y a la noche estudia en el colegio. Francisca hace más de 5 años tiene su negocio, quien gracias a su esfuerzo, a la buena administración y a la ayuda de su marido pudieron agrandar el negocio ya que cuenta con una clientela formada por la buena ubicación que tiene su local. Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como azúcar, arroz, fideos, bebidas, panificados, embutidos, etc.

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, noodles, pastries, sausages, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ni Made Sri Wahyuni

texts.id:
Besides being a housewife whose daily work are to care for children and other household work, Ni Made Sri Wahyuni also has a business that supports their family income. That business is cacao sales. She has been in this business for almost 2 years, and has given satisfactory income of Rp25,000 (about US$3)/day from the Rp500,000 (about US$60) capital she owned. Buying harvest from cocoa farmers, Made Sri started her activities daily from 10:00 AM to 4:00PM buying cocoa fruits from farmers and selling it to wholesalers, and the profit came from difference between buying & selling price. Lack of capital, has been a problem in the past, and she could not compete with other salespersons. However, after receiving capital help from Dinari, her business grows, and more farmers too sold their harvest to Made Sri. Today Made Sri could buy 200kg with a profit of Rp100,000 (about $11)/day. With that Made Sri could support her 2 children, Luh Sinta who already goes to Grade school, and Made Sonia, who is still a toddler.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Di samping sebagai ibu rumah tangga yang dalam keseharianya mengurus anak dan pekerjaan rumah tangga lainnya , Ni Made Sri Wahyuni juga memiliki usaha yang sangat mendukung pendapatan keluarganya . Usaha itu adalah Usaha sebagai Pedagang Kakau . Usaha yang telah di jalankannya hampir dua tahun ini mempunyai hasil yang sangat lumayan yaitu sebesar Rp 25.000/hari dari Rp 500.000 modal yang dimiliki . Dengan membeli hasil panen dari petani yang memiliki tanaman kakau , Made Sri memulai kegiatannya setiap hari dari pukul 10.00 pagi sampai 04.00 sore membeli buah kakau dari petani dan menjual kembali kepada pengepul ( pedagang besar ) dengan keuntungan yang di peroleh dari selisih harga beli dan penjualan . Kekurangan modal , dulu sering menjadi hambatan Made Sri dalam menjalankan usaha ini sehingga kalah bersaing dengan pedagang lain . Namun setelah mendapat bantuan modal dari Dinari , usahanya semakin berkembang dan petani pun makin banyak menjual hasil panennya kepada Made Sri. Rata-rata saat ini Made Sri bisa membeli barang dagangan 200 Kg dengan keuntungan sebesar Rp 100,000,- / hari . Dengan hasil ini Made Sri dapat membiayai dua orang anakNya yaitu Luh Sinta yang telah duduk di bangku SD dan Made Sonia yang masih balita.

loans.use:
To add capital so that could buy more cocoa beans

Sebagai tambahan modal usaha agar dapat membeli biji kakao dalam jumlah yang lebih banyak

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Mrs. Julia is a partner of the Communal Bank “Women for the development of Pariahuaca”, she dedicates herself to the sale of grains, wheat, different varieties of corn, and hulled wheat and corn for wholesale (in sacks), her business is located at the market in the Province of Huaraz, in the city of Ancash, she sells on Mondays and Thursdays. With this loan of 1,800 soles, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will buy 5 sacks of corn to hull and 5 sacks of wheat to hull as well. She is 45 years old, she is married and has 4 children, 2 of which are independents. She lives with her husband and 2 grandchildren whom she takes care of. Her husband is a driver with his own car, thanks to it he can help her move her products to the market.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Ella es la señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Desarrollo de Pariahuanca”, se dedica a la venta de granos, trigo, maíz de diferentes variedades y pelado de trigo y de maíz al por mayor (por sacos), su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la feria de la provincia de Huaraz, Departamento de Ancash, vende los días lunes y jueves. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,800.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará 5 sacos de maíz cuzqueño para hacer pelado y 5 sacos de trigo para también hacer pelado de trigo. Ella tiene 45 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos son independientes. Vive con su esposo y dos nietos que tiene en su poder. Su esposo es chofer y cuenta con un carro (auto) propio, gracias a ello le puede apoyar con el traslado de sus productos hacia la feria.

loans.use: The purchase of grain for wholesale

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara Beatriz is a 58-year-old mother of six children, of which three are independent, and three are still dependent on her since they are studying technical careers. She wants them to complete their studies successfully so they will be able to work.

Sara studied this fine art of knitting and embroidery long ago, and now that she has made it her business, it has brought in significant income, despite not having a suitable place to do her work. Since Mrs. Sara uses a space within her home to do this work, and the space is limited, it is important for her to improve her space. Mrs. Sara's goal is to rent a crafts workshop, and organize and develop it completely so she can share her skills with other moms in her community. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan in order to be able to rent a space and purchase materials.

With your support, Mrs Sara will realize her dream in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Sara Beatriz tiene 58 años de edad es madre de seis hijos, de los cuales tres de ellos ya son independientes, quedando sólo tres a su cargo y bajo su protección ya que están estudiando carreras técnicas, ella sólo quiere que sus hijos terminen sus estudios satisfactoriamente para que puedan trabajar. Sara estudió este bello arte de manualidades (tejidos y bordados) hace mucho tiempo, se desenvuelve en el ya que se ha convertido en el sustento económico significativo de su hogar; a pesar de no tener un local apropiado la señora Sara ocupa un lugar en su vivienda para trabajar, debido a este hecho le urge mejorar su ambiente.Para la señora Sara su propósito es poner un taller de manualidades a fin de e implementarlo completamente para desarrollar y compartir sus habilidades con otras madres de su comunidad, para este fin requiere de un préstamo para alquilar un local y la compra de sus materiales. Con tu apoyo la señora Sara podrá concretar su propósito en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: To start her business. (IMPLEMENTAR SU NEGOCIO)

loans.name: Chao

texts.en:
