Mrs. Chao N., 38, works collecting rubber, making on average $1.60 a day. Her husband Mr. Leang Chor, 41, runs a business as a motor-taxi driver and every day earns $1.50 a day. They have 3 children, two of whom work in a factory in Phnom Penh earning $60 each a month.

Mr. Leang really wants to create another business as now what he earns every day is not enough for daily expenses, so he needs some money to purchase a plot of farmland to do farming.

In addition to this land, a small part of the money will be used to buy rubber to resell and make an extra profit. For sure, all this is just a dream unless he can get a loan from KIVA.org. So this couple is requesting a loan from KIVA of US$ 750.

loans.use: purchase a plot of farmland and rubber for re-sale

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta, a mother, was very concerned when her family's household needs were not being met. So, in addition to caring for her family, she decided to start her own business. At first, she sold nice clothing without much success, so she decided to knit sweaters in various colors and designs and sell on a smaller scale. Thanks to continued business from her customers and her great desire to get ahead and improve her business, she was driven to seek a loan in order to buy more raw materials and be able to fill all of the orders that she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Modesta, es una madre de familia muy preocupada que observando la insatisfacción de las necesidades de su hogar decidió emprender un negocio sin descuidar los requerimientos de los miembros de su familia, fue así como al principio ofertaba prendas de vestir sin acoger buenos resultados, entonces decidió tejer chompas de diversos colores y diseños para ofertarlos en menor escala fue así como gracias a las solicitudes de sus clientes y a su gran ánimo por mejorar y progresar con su labor la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima a fin de concretar cada una de las solicitudes que ha ido albergando.

loans.use: Purchase of additional raw materials

loans.name: Uwezo's Uwenacho Group

texts.en:
Uwezo is 28 years old and is divorced with 1 child, age 3. Uwezo is a cow seller; she started her business in 2006. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Mwanaisha, who has a business dealing in cloth sales.

loans.use: To expand her cow business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and the mother of two children. She has been treking to the northern part of Ghana to buy tubes of yam, dried fish and dried tilapia and retailing them in her town for the past five years. Due to the current food shortage, the demand for yams and other foodstuffs are very high. Ama wants to use her loan to buy more tubes of yam, dried tilapia and fish, to avoid price hikes, and also to increase sales. She hopes to start saving for her children’s education with this loan. Ama is member of the group called Francis. Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Ama is holding her son in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fresh tubes of yam, dried tilapia and dried fish

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en:
Mrs. Nheb C., age 56, and her husband, live across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for 20 years and have 3 daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. The youngest daughter sells meatballs in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Nheb has been a silk weaver for 29 years. This is a skill that she learned from a nearby villager. She sells her finished products to a man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband raises cows in the village. Mrs. Nheb is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk material for weaving..

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo is 36 years old and she is a teacher. She's married and she has 2 sons who are at primary school. She owns her own home and it has electricity, water and a drainage system. Her home is in the district of Jr Bolognesi in the province of Yunguyo.

Due to her low income she also needs to do other things such as offering a photocopying service, a small bookshop (selling notebooks, folders, graph paper, pencils, ink pens, coloured pens, a variety of paper) from the school. This was a way of increasing her income.

To be able to increase merchandise she managed to join the group Banco Comunal Winay Marca which she has belonged to for some years. Her first credit was of $300 new soles which she invested in writing materials (packets of bond paper, writing books, ink pens, a variety of paper).

With the loan of $1000 (new soles) which she will pay back in 4 months, she will put in some phone booths for cellphone calls, and this will enable her to increase her income.

She has learned that women should be given their place, and her husband helps her a lot in the different activities that she does. Her vision is to buy a house in Tacna or Arequipa and a car so that her kids will get good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Consuelo tiene 36 años de edad, tiene como profesión profesora, es casada, tiene dos hijos varones, están en el nivel primario, casa propia cuenta con luz , agua y desague. Su domicilio esta ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo. Debido a sus bajos ingresos económicos, es que se vio obligada a desarrollar otras actividades como; servicios de fotocopiado y pequeña librería (venta de cuadernos, fólderes, papelógrafos, lapiceros, lápiz , plumones, colores, variedad de papeles) aun inicio dentro del pedagógico. Fue un medio para poder incrementar su ingreso. Para poder incrementar mercadería, logro integrar el Banco Comunal Wiñay Marca quien pertenece hace nueve años atrás, accediendo a un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en material de escritorio (paquetes de papel bond, cuadernos, plumones, variedad papelería). Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, instalará cabinas de locutorio para llamadas a celular, con esto incrementará un poco mas sus ingresos. Lo que aprendió es que las mujeres deben darse su lugar, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, en las diferentes actividades que realiza. Su visión futura comprar una casa en el departamento de Tacna o Arequipa, y un automóvil, darles una buena profesión a sus hijos.

loans.use: To put in phone booths/Instalación de cabinas para locutorio.

loans.name: Davlatmoh

texts.ru:
Davlatmoh T. lives in Nurek. She is a businesswoman and sells fabrics at the central market. She would like to take out a loan for the autumn and the arrival of cold weather to purchase winter fabrics. Davlatmoh purchases her products in Dushanbe.

Davlatmoh has been in this business for 18 years, ever since her husband abandoned her family and she was left alone with 6 children to support. She now tries to give her children everything that she can. Davlatmoh’s oldest son needs to apply to college and as a result she needs to work very hard. Davlatmoh will pay back her loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Тоджиддинова Давлатмо проживает в городе Нурек. Занимается бизнесом. Торгует тканями на центральном рынке. К осеннему сезону , к приходу холодов хочет получить кредит и уже завезти зимние ткани. Привозит она товар из города Душанбе . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 18 лет , с того момента как муж оставил их семью и она осталась одна с шестью детьми на руках. Теперь она старается дать детям все по мере возможности. Старший сын должен поступать в ВУЗ , поэтому ей необходимо очень много работать. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa M.  vive en la zona de villa cooperativa  de la ciudad de El Alto con su hijo de 12 años, el cual estudia en una escuela fiscal de la zona. Tiene su casa propia hecha de adobe.
 
La Sra. Comercializa chuño y tunta en la población de Senkata los fines de semana en la feria, además vende queso el cual elabora todos los días de la leche de sus ganados.

El crédito lo destinara para capital de trabajo. 
 
Es su segundo  crédito con Impro, los exhortamos a confiar en ella
texts.en:
Luisa M. lives in the Cooperativa neighborhood in the city of El Alto with her 12 year old son who studies in a local school. She has her own house which is made of adobe. She sells products derived from potatoes, “chuño” and “tunta”, in the Senkata weekend market in addition to cheese that she makes everyday with the milk from her cows. This loan will goes towards working capital. It is her second loan with Impro and we urge you to trust her.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 49 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “ Mujeres Rumbo al Éxito II”, ella tiene como meta arreglar la fachada de su casa, convertirlo en una tienda y vivir de su alquiler.  Tiene 4 hijos y es madre soltera, después de la separación con su esposo que era alcohólico, ella se ha dedicado a sacar adelante a sus hijos, a pesar de haber concluido una carrera en docencia de educación primaria ella manifiesta que no encuentra trabajo por lo que se le hace difícil dedicarse a su profesión.

Ella nos dice que gracias  a la zona donde vive; que es una zona comercial en la ciudad de Huaraz, puede alquilar su inmueble y así ayudarse con las rentas que le proporciona.  Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, la misma que trae desde la ciudad (Lima) y lo reparte a domicilio.

Con este préstamo de s/. 300 soles, que pagará en cuatro cuotas, iniciará la reconstrucción de la fachada principal de su local para alquiler.
texts.en:
Señora María is 49 years old and member of the community bank "Mujeres Rumbo al Éxito II" (Women on course for success II). She has as a goal to fix the front of her home, convert it into a shop, and live from her rental. She has four children and is a single mother. After the separation with her husband who was an alcoholic, she has been dedicated to making a better life for her children. Despite having the education to become a teacher of primary school, she has not been able to encounter a job and it is difficult to make a living with her profession. She tells us that thanks to the area where she lives (she lives in a commercial zone of the city of Huaraz), she can rent her property and receive help from the income that it provides. She is dedicated to selling clothes by orders, which she picks up in the city (Lima) and delivers to her customers at her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintenance of her commercial property

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru:
Олимчон Умирзаков мужчина в возросте 39 лет , женат имеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка занимается домашними делами и уходом за детьми.Олимчон работает постухом в колхозе.Он хорошо разбирается в мелкорогатом скоту. У него на сегоднешний день более 30 коз и 20 баранов.
Посёлок Утконсой расположен вблизи гор и все жители посёлка посут свой скот на пригорной окружности.И только поздно вечером скот пригоняют домой.Олимчон узнав что взяв кредит можно расширить свой бизнес, решил обратится в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Olimjon U. is a thirty-nine-year-old man who is married and has three children. His wife is a housewife who does housework and cares for their children. Olimjon works as a shepherd on a collective farm. He is very knowledgeable about sheep and goats. At present, he has more than thirty goats and twenty rams. The village of Utkonsoi is located near mountains, and all of the village’s inhabitants pasture their livestock in the foothills. Only late at night do they drive the livestock home. Olimjon, having learned that he can expand his business by taking out a loan, has decided to apply for one through MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying livestock and feed

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy L., 36, and her husband, Ponlork Phom, 49, live in a small village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have five children; three sons and two daughters. Two children are garment factory workers and the other three children attend school. Soy L.'s mother also lives with her.

Soy has been a garment factory worker for eight years. Her husband has been in the army for twenty years. He travels to work by motor taxi and the costs are high. Soy is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase one motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase one motorbike for driving to work.

loans.name: Mr. Sokha Rith Phan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Kroay Wat village in Kampong Chhnang province make up this village bank loan and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Sokha Rith P. was selected by the group members to be the village bank president. He is a firewood seller in the local village. Since this business is doing well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to purchase more firewood to resell. This will help to increase his income and improve their living conditions. His wife, Mrs. Pan Chida, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Mr. Sokha Rith P. is 34 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is only four years old. 

One member in this village bank loan has an end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. This client is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to resell.

loans.name: Kodjovito

texts.fr: A. Kodjovito est  âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants Il est un charcutier dynamique, une exploitation qu’il tient à côté d’un maquis de la place à Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Mr. Kodjovito espère gagner un sa vie. Avec cette opportunité de Kiva et son deuxième crédit de FECECAV, il désire accroître la taille de son activité par achat de volailles, de bovins pour sa charcuterie. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre pleinement en charge les besoins de ses enfants qui sont tous en âge scolaire.
texts.en:
Kodjovito A. is 32 years old, married, and the father of two. He is an energetic butcher with a shop located next to a local eatery in Lomé, the Togolese capital. He hopes to earn a living. With this Kiva opportunity and his second FECECAV loan, he would like to expand his business by buying poultry and cattle for his butcher shop. The profits derived from his work will enable him to take full care of his children, who are all school-age.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy poultry and cattle for his butcher shop

loans.name: Eva Felicidad

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Eva Felicidad M. es una dama que se dedica a laborar arduamente para mejorar las condiciones de su casa de habitación. Su dedicación es la crianza de cerdos o ganado porcino el cual desde hace 5 años ha logrado desempeñar en su propia localidad.

Actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de productos para engorde de cerdos y de esta manera mejora sus condiciones de vida proporcionándole mejores oportunidades a su familia el cual se compone de ella que es una madre soltera y de sus tres hijos que debe mantener por ser estudiantes menores de edad.
texts.en:
In the area of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega is Eva, a woman who dedicates herself arduously to improve the conditions of her household. She makes a living raising pigs, which she has been able to carry out in her own place for the past five years. Currently, Eva has come to Kiva partner Ceprodel to request a loan that would allow her to purchase feed to fatten her pigs and in this way she will be able to earn more money so she can improve her living conditions and provide better opportunities for her family. She is a single mother with three children whom she provides for since they are young and still in school.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Salafai

texts.en:
Salafai T., 19, is married with one child. She sells banana and taro and her husband does the planting and looks after the plantation. She sells to the village people and general public three days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about $83). SPBD loans are Salafai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Salafai wants to focus on her business because she believes it will help immensely in the uplifting of their living standards.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, chemicals and equipment

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys P. is 50 years old.  She is a married mother of nine children.  According to her, her last two children are still in school – junior high school. The rest are out of school and running their own businesses. She lives with some of her children in a family house in Nkawkaw, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

She says though her husband is employed, she still needs to work hard to help herself.

Gladys deals in smoked and fried fish.  She procures smoked fish all the way from Yeji in the north.  She sells to retailers in her community. Gladys has been in business since her youthful days.  She wants a loan to procure smoked fish in bulk.  Gladys also deals in second hand clothes.  She aspires to give her last two children the best education.

loans.use: Procure smoked fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk for her business

loans.name: Ebtissam

texts.en:
Ebtissam is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Ebtissam has been selling used clothes for a year. She requested a loan of $500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase clothes for her work. This is the first time that Ebtissam has requested a loan.

Ebtissam is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her work, she didn’t face any difficulties. Nadia decided on doing her work because of her experience and she also likes the contact she has with her clients. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Ebtissam will use the loan to purchase clothes for her work

loans.name: Orzubek

texts.ru: Сангов Орзубек житель района Гиссар. Возраст 35 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Работает водителем частного такси. Автомобиль собственный, поэтому ремонт придется делать за свой счет. Поэтому он решил получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить автозапчасти.
texts.en:
Orzubek S. lives in Gissar. He is 35 years old and is married with 3 children. He has a high school diploma and works as a taxi driver. He uses his own car, which he has to repair at his own cost. He is applying for a loan in order to buy spare parts.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: car repair

loans.name: Confort Group

texts.en:
Y. L., 36, is married with four children, aged 12, 9 and 5 years, and the youngest being 9 months old. He has a business of selling kitchen ware that he started two years ago. He works from 9am to 5pm everyday. He earns a monthly profit of around $177. This will be Y.’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants a loan to increase the stock of his kitchen ware.

Y. will share this loan with his group, Confort, which has 19 members. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture above, Y. is in blue shirt.

loans.use: To increase stock of kitchen ware

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Mrs. Lolita P. is 63 years old and married with four children. She is from Silongon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She started a business when she became a member of Paglaum MPC in July 2008 and now she's on her fifth loan cycle. 

She is seeking PHP 7,000 for additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store to buy stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries and other household items. With her previous loans, she demonstrated outstanding loan repayment. She aims to have a successful business with a concrete store and to save for their old age.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
La señora Dalila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. de Guadalupe”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 48 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Tiene 13 años dedicándose a la venta de pollos desviscerados, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, vendiendo pocos pollos, luego tuvo mucha acogida y clientes fuertes.
Así, siguió superándose, ahora vende pollos en cantidad. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, en un ambiente alquilado del Mercado Central, donde brinda el servicio, a los moradores de la comunidad y amas de casa.  Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  pollos vivos en jabas y  parte del dinero lo invertirá comprando herramientas nuevas como una balanza digital y cuchillos nuevos para remplazar a la que ahora tiene.

Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio.
Dalila Dice: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Dalila belongs to the Our Lady of Guadalupe Communal Bank located in the Bellavista district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is 48 years old, has a partner, is mother to 4 children, 2 of whom are still dependent upon her. She has been selling butchered chickens for 13 years in the city’s Central Market. She began with a loan from Manuela Ramos selling a few chickens, becoming very accepted with steady customers. She continued her successful business and now she sells chickens in bulk. Today she has the same business in a rented stall in the Central Market where she provides service to the restaurants and housewives. With this loan for S/.3000.00 Nuevos Soles she will buy crates of live chickens and with part of the money buy new tools like a digital scale and new knives to replace the one she now has. Today she is an independent woman and she manages and makes the decisions for her business. Dalila says: Belonging to a group of women has helped her better know her rights and together they work to be respected.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy crates of live chickens

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice E. sells Fan Milk ice cream at Elmina. Beatrice has a senior high school education.  She is divorced and has four dependents. Beatrice has been selling Fan Milk ice cream since 2004. She is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. Her loan will be used to buy more ice cream for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more ice cream for resale
